No ordinary car, the X-9 Assault Vehicle gives Road Hazard a deadly array of weapons and speed when he hits the streets. He’s constantly looking for races or other opportunities to test the limits of this supermachine, and will quickly identify heroes with super-cars of their own as rivals to be challenged. His criminal activities will earn the attention of any hero who wants to make their city, and particularly their streets, safer by putting him behind bars.

194313.name: The Mystagogue (Hybrid Class)
194313.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original concept by Palak Shah, the Mystagogue is a hybrid class, a mixture of the Cleric and Sorcerer. Although the Diocesan from the 2015 December Player Paraphernalia Special provided a hybrid class of the same two core classes, Palak's concept and contributions takes the class more into the realm of bloodlines and an eclectic mix of arcane and divine spells. New feats are also included tailored for some of this class's unique abilities.

194314.name: Feats of Sloth
194314.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of the More Feats! product line introduces a new kind of feat: the sin feat. Sin feats are designed to represent a character’s vices and moral failings, though they are by no means restricted to evil or non-good characters. Though a few sin feats are supernatural in nature, and some even grant bonuses of the profane type, characters of any faith or alignment may wrestle with sinful vices – grappling with and overcoming such a moral complication often serves to highlight a character’s heroism.

Feats of Sloth includes twelve new feats for lazy sinners: Attended, Combat Procrastinator, Deep Sleeper, Hibernate, Lazy Leadership, Lethargic Litany, Slothful Spell, Slothful Sprawl, Sluggish Stroll, Wearisome Warrior, Thy Will Be Done, and Yawn.

194315.name: The Emergency Settlement Collection
194315.description:
From publisher blurb:

For GMs in need of civilization! When you need a fully-detailed settlement right now, "The Emergency Settlement Collection" comes to your rescue. Ranging from tiny villages to massive metropolises, each of these six ready-to-play settlements comes with a straightforward overview, history, notable locations, interesting characters, settlement statistics, new rules for PCs in or from the settlement, and secrets for the PCs to explore. Each settlement can serve as a jumping-off point for adventure, or a home base for an entire campaign. Maps of each settlement (tagged for GMs and untagged for PCs) are also included.

"The Emergency Settlement Collection" contains a city of art and song beset by dangerous foliage, an industrial metropolis bound to nefarious patrons, a gnome boom town amid a firearms revolution, a reclusive village of nature-warping lizardfolk, a plane-hopping city of vicious cannibals, and a sleepy frontier village near a pit of danger and adventure.

194316.name: Blockade
194316.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blockade is a Game-in-a-Can scenario presented by Storyweaver Productions, and is an excellent way to start gaming in the High-Space universe. It is structured by major scenes, with key people and plot points described within each. We recommend the Game Master becomes familiar with each scene, and encourage the heroes to ‘go their own way.’

THE STORY SO FAR...

Commander Alexandra Pang smiled as the Wrath of Light & Heat slotted into a high-altitude orbit over Sat-G3, directly eclipsing ‘Industrial Facility S-25’, the small Astatine processing facility operated by Smaw Commercial.

“Smaw facility, this is Commander Pang of the Armada warship Wrath of Light & Heat; you are now under blockade and will remain so until you comply with U.R.C. directive 625.8 paragraph 57.c.”

Just saying the words made Pang warm inside.The response came after several minutes delay. “Sturmian warship. We do not recognise your authority here... and what the hell is U.R.C. directive 625... whatever!”

“Received, Smaw facility. Your lack of knowledge of a legal directive does not concern me. All docked vessels, and vessels on approach, are now under blockade. All vessels on an outbound trajectory that traverses our sphere of orbit are to return to the facility. Failure to comply will be treated as a breach of this legal blockade. The Armada exercises its right to enforce U.R.C. law.”

As Pang expected, there was a sudden rush of small craft away from the Smaw facility towards the nearest other orbital, Icecastle, a Froster Commercial owned facility.“Firing solutions coming in now, Commander,” said the weapons officer.

“No. Let them go. There are too many to shoot them all. It would cause problems.”

The weapons officer shrugged, wondering if the Commander was having an exceptionally good day to let these law-breakers get away...

This Adventure is a a quick diversion for your heroes… An ordinary trip turns into an ‘interesting opportunity’ when an Armada warship interdicts an Astatine processor owned by a powerful Commercial. Why are the Armada suddenly enforcing the obscure by-laws of the U.R.C.? Is this one captain’s personal agenda, or part of a larger power play? With several Commercials now involved or impacted, it’s hard to see the line that separates the players from those being played. And when the lights go out, and the air starts to run out, who will think of all the lives suddenly in danger? Blockade can be played as part of the Anti-Pattern campaign for High-Space, or as a self-contained adventure for a group of timely heroes.

rpg: P.E.R.K.: The Pretty Easy Roleplaying Kit
194317.name: P.E.R.K.: Hollywood Ninja Class Perk
194317.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hollywood Ninja Class Perk is more than what the name suggests. Yes, it is a single Class Perk for the PERK roleplaying system, but it's also a 13 page 'microsetting' source book that gives you all of the gear, skills, perks and ninjitsu powers you need to play/run a movie ninja themed game. If you like high flying martial arts action, mystical ninja powers and skulking around in the darkness shooting things with a blowgun then this is for you. Not all ninjas are created the same! This text allows for many configurations of ninja skills and they mix well with any of the PERK Roles to ensure that your ninja is unique.

194318.name: Bulletproof Blues Character Pack 003.02
194318.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Bulletproof Blues Character Pack contains high resolution, royalty-free character artwork from the Bulletproof Blues supplements Ruins Of Atlanta and Evangelists Of Mars.

Twenty pieces of artwork are by James Shields (greyscale and color versions for ten characters), and two pieces of artwork are by Sean Izaakse (one for Avalon, and one illustration of a Martian). Characters' Bulletproof Blues character sheets in PDF and Bulletproof Blues Character Sheet Helper format are also included.

Sixteen characters are included:

Atty Gen Clifford Montgomery
Avalon
Dr Athanor
Koan The Unknowable
Martha
Beacon (Martian)
Lens (Martian)
Motion (Martian)
Vessel (Martian)
Weaver (Martian)
MOD
Oskar Jaeger
Shade
Stephanie Hatsu
Thrasher Jim
Yellow Jacket Jane

194319.name: Bulletproof Blues Character Pack 004.02: Black Orchid
194319.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Bulletproof Blues Character Pack contains one high resolution, royalty-free character illustration from artist John Zeleznik: Black Orchid. Black Orchid's Bulletproof Blues character sheet in PDF and Bulletproof Blues Character Sheet Helper format is also included.

194320.name: Pyre
194320.description:
From publisher blurb:

A former pyromaniac and thief, Stuart Caine found a higher calling as a servant of the cult of Gezh’ri. Merged with a fire elemental, he now wields considerable power as Pyre

In addition to Pyre, there is a higher powered 2.0 version featuring a versatile and more powerful version of the character to oppose your heroes.

Also featuring Orochi, an Asian Crime Lord with a secret, and his Gargoyle servant.

194321.name: In The Company of Rakshasa
194321.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash Your Hunger!

Come discover the secrets of the rakshasa. They are hunger made manifest, insatiable earthbound spirits born in blasphemy. Be the apex predator slipping unseen among the mortal masses, befuddling their mind, senses, and emotions while you dine on all the physical and spiritual tastes the mortal world can offer.

Play the 1st-20th level rakshasa paragon class that allows you to eventually become a Rakshasa Maharaja! Create the rakshasa you want to play right alongside all the dwarven fighters, the elven wizards, and human barbarians, in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.Choose the native outsider race the yaksha, with its racial traits, alternate racial traits, favored class bonuses, and racial feats that will allow you to play minor rakshasa with any base class. Select from among the racial archetypes for the Monk, Slayer (Advance Class Guide), and The Luckbringer (Rite Publishing’s The Secrets of Adventuring) so you can bring the true nature of the rakshasa to bear.

Now come and play a Rakshasa!

194322.name: Fey Folio
194322.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Innovations, Fey Folio offers a focused set of Summoning spells for those of the Fey persuasion. In addition, others spells are included that allow the caster to temporarily grant feyness to himself or another.

194323.name: The Last Train to Darksville
194323.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for Master Characters

A rail caravan from Devil’s Breach to Darksville has failed to show up for three days running, and no one in Devil’s Breach can figure out why. It’s up to the player characters to investigate what’s keeping the trains from running on time as they ride what may well be the last train to Darksville. This adventure is designed for master characters. Lower-level characters had best not apply.

194324.name: The Grinding Gears of Heaven (4E)
194324.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the twelfth and penultimate adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

The End Has Already Begun

Things are falling apart. An attempt by the Obscurati conspiracy to create a more perfect world was sabotaged, and the world is descending into chaos. With mere months before the planet is devoured by the cosmic gears of the graveyard of the multiverse, the party undertakes an extraplanar expedition to find the means to fix the conspiracy's disastrous failure.

But there in the Gyre, at the center of oblivion, a primordial serpent known as the Voice of Rot has coiled itself around the physical manifestation of time itself, and it intends to drag the party's world to its destined destruction. The party must slay the rough beast if they wish to hold together their dying world so that tomorrow can be born.
An adventure for psychopompic heroes of 28th level.

194325.name: The Grinding Gears of Heaven (Pathfinder)
194325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the twelfth and penultimate adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

The End Has Already Begun

Things are falling apart. An attempt by the Obscurati conspiracy to create a more perfect world was sabotaged, and the world is descending into chaos. With mere months before the planet is devoured by the cosmic gears of the graveyard of the multiverse, the party undertakes an extraplanar expedition to find the means to fix the conspiracy's disastrous failure.

But there in the Gyre, at the center of oblivion, a primordial serpent known as the Voice of Rot has coiled itself around the physical manifestation of time itself, and it intends to drag the party's world to its destined destruction. The party must slay the rough beast if they wish to hold together their dying world so that tomorrow can be born.

An adventure for psychopompic heroes of 20th level.

194326.name: Slayer
194326.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Took me two weeks but I finally tracked down the Red-Hand of Garn. I won’t give you the details about how he got his name; it’s not for telling this close to dinner. Suffice to say, he will no longer be bothering anyone“
Songa, Slayer for hire

Characters in RPGs often have abilities are not tied to their class, race or skill, although they may be related/useful to it. These are called Feats.

They may be combat related, a way to tweak spells or even to do with the crafting of an item. Some will be useful to almost everyone, others only in very certain circumstances.

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based on a certain theme or subject – features feats for the Slayer, the combination of range and rogue which together will make it a bad day for their chosen target.

The feats you'll find inside:

Fortified Slayer - Can re-roll Fort saves
Improved Tracking - Allows you to re-roll tracking rolls
Improved Training - Level is tretaed as being higher when rolling for level based effects
Master Targeting - Allows you to have more than one Target feat active at once
Slayer Reflexes - Can re-roll Reflex saves
Slayers’ Eye - You can re-roll ranged to hit rolls
Sneaky Slayer - You can re-roll damage related rolls to any sneak-based attacks
Target Knowledge - Increase damage done to target
Target Prediction - Increase chances of hitting target
Targets Methods - Gain a bonus to your AC

194327.name: Soul Breaker
194327.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have two sets of five Types (Attributes). Each Type, except Strength, has a numeric value called Rank. Each Type in set one has an associated Dice Type (d4, d6, d12, d20, d100) and the set includes Strength/Physical, Endurance, Ability, Mind, and Soul. Set two includes Dexterity, Strength/Frame, Error Defense, Error Skill, and Hack. Characters also have a variety of Skill. Character progression is tracked in Levels, with an associated sub-category called Spirit. Levels and Spirit are tracked for three separate categories: Combat, Hacking, and Endurance.

The game's organization is somewhat confusing and clarity is not helped by numerous grammatical errors and random in-rules attempts at sophomoric humor.

194328.name: Alien vs Predator: Predalien Expansion
194328.description:
From the publisher:
The Predalien is a Xenomorph spawned from a Predator host. It is the death that nearly all Predators fear, allowing themselves fall victim in such a way is deemed a dishonorable death.

The Predalien is much larger and stronger than the human-spawned Xenomorphs and appears to hold no role within the Hive and instead acts independently hunting and killing until Death!"

194329.name: Sickle APC
194329.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a anti gravity APC.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

194330.name: Cry of Ill Omen (5E)
194330.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to six PCs of levels 8-10

The quaint fairytale village of Prince’s Folly is stuck in a recurring nightmare. The brooks no longer bubble, the children no longer frolic, and the giant daisies have all withered and died.

Every there years the banshee comes to Prince’s Folly to portend the death of a member of the McDonagal family. For seven long nights she wails in anguish and for as long as she cries a darkness descends upon the land. The skies grow dark, the plants wither and die, and even the Great Barrow river runs black as ink. It seems all of creation mourns the death of a McDonagal.

After the death has come to pass, both the banshee and the darkness leave Prince’s Folly to be replaced by a perpetual spring and an abundant harvest; every year greater than the year before. It seems that although the banshee brings a week of death, she also blesses the village with three years of abundant life.

Once more the banshee has returned to Prince’s Folly, but this time her cry seems to know no end. It’s been 21 days of the darkness. The people are starving and fresh water is impossible to find. The death toll is mounting and the banshee wails for the town every night.

It seems this time the banshee has come to stay.

Also included in “Cry of Ill Omen”:

The River Banshee, a new monster for your 5th Edition game
Variant wails to use for your banshee. It doesn’t have to mean death.
3 new magic items including Ballinderry's lucky coin
A new artifact, the Comb of the Banshee
New druid/ranger spell: Calm Plants

194331.name: Rune Lords 4
194331.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven Spectacular Mythic Monsters for your AP!

Mythic Module Monsters: Rune Lords 4 brings you mythic versions of all six monsters in the bestiary section of issue #4 in the official Rune Lords AP:

deathweb
hound of Tindalos
redcap
runeslave template
scanderig (forgefiend)
shining child
taiga giant




The Mythic Monster Manual and Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games have greatly expanded the number of mythic monsters available for use in Pathfinder campaigns of any kind, but if you want to add a bit of mythic mayhem to the classic adventure paths produced by Paizo, Inc., the Mythic Module Monsters series is designed just for you! Rather than having to hunt through multiple books trying to find the odd monster here or there to enhance your adventure path experience, you'll find the monsters introduced in that AP right here, ready to pick up exactly the issues you need to enhance the mythic monsters in your favorite adventure! You can pick them up a few at a time or collect an entire series for your favorite AP!

194332.name: Hybrid Class: Fury
194332.description:
From publisher blurb:

UNLEASH THE FURY!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen created a new hybrid class designed to deliver the purest of smackdowns – the focus of rage and martial arts skill combined into one ass-kicking compound combatant! The mighty master of wrath comes complete with three archetypes: Maimed, Revenant, and Vengeful!

194333.name: Arctic FoXX
194333.description:
From publisher blurb:

Based on an original character by Pin-Up model, cosplayer, and roleplayer Jenny Poussin (and used with her permission), Arctic Foxx is Jenny Poussin's heroic alter-ego, a cold based heroine seeking to make the world a better place while protecting it from her nemesis, the evil Black Ice.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

194334.name: Killjoy
194334.description:
From publisher blurb:

WTF?!

Born with a terminal disease, Ti Rawlins developed a sort of “gallows humor” at an early age. Saved by a secret procedure, then recruited by the military's Meta Division, Ti went on to hunt down bad guys for the government. When he discovered the M Division was really run by the Horde, he left, changed his outfit, and turned to helping the superhero community. As Killjoy (PL 8), he spends his time assisting where needed, and annoying friend and foe alike while doing it.

194335.name: Starriders
194335.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves selecting a Race and then distribute a points pool into four Attributes: Body, Mind, Psyche, and Energy/Instinct. Characters then distribute a separate points pool into Skill values. A few derived values (Life Points, Psychic Points) are calculated, and vary during play. Characters will have additional Powers (varying from fairly mundane to nearly supernatural), depending on their Attribute values.

194336.name: Oceans of Blood
194336.description:
From publisher blurb:

DAH-DUM ... DAAAAH-DUM ...

Welcome to Oceans of Blood the first in Rogue Genius Games’ line of 5e Monster Menagerie conversions. The theme is threats of the sea, with an emphasis on monsters that bite, tear, and rend. Designer Rich Howard has converted Sam Hing’s original aquatic adversaries into 5e, providing you with creatures ranging from the mindless CR 1 harpoon weed to the incomprehensible CR 14 anemone behemoth, with enough surprises in between to spice up seaborne adventures of any level. We’re confident that you’ll find something useful in this, our first 5e Monster Menagerie. We have chummed the pages to draw out the nastiest of swimming slayers, and they’re ready to make your players afraid to go back to the beach. Dive in, and see how warm the red waters are.

194337.name: 10+ Treasure Vault
194337.description:
From publisher blurb:

10+ Treasure Vault is a compilation of all of our previous 10+ Treasures volumes, with some additional magic items drawn from our extensive and excellent library of Dungeon World classes, giving it a total of 147 magic items.

Its purpose (aside from giving you a bunch of magic items and magic item-creating tips) is to provide a more convenient print option: instead of ordering all of the individual 10+ Treasures volumes, you can instead get everything in one, substantially larger book (and PDF).

194338.name: Verliebt - Verlobt - Verheiratet
194338.description:
User sumary:
The title is a german nursery rhyme. Something like "in love - engaged to be married - married".
3 to 8 players (on the box it is written incorrectly as 3-12 players) can do this funny boardgame with many hearts and luck.
First you have to select, if you are a man (turn your pawn clockwise) or a woman (turn your pawn anticlockwise). Everyone gets 10 hearts, the money in this game. Roll the dice and move your pawn along the coloured fields. On the yellow fields you get a yellow card with your interests (jazz, football, politics). On the green fields you get characteristics (angry, smart). If two players meet each other, they can fall in love (romantic) and check their performance (economically). Sometimes you have to pay with red hearts or get black hearts (white fields) and you have to pay for optimizing your interests and characteristics.
After a specified time all players sum up their red and black hearts and the winner is the heart with the most.

194339.name: The Evil of Witche's Fen
194339.description:
From the publishers notes:

Completing your last mission brought you to Lankwick, a town best forgotten. You await the infrequent arrival of a ship to return you to civilized lands. In the meantime, danger, disease and even treasure can be found in the evil reaches of Witches Fen.

This one-page hex-crawl adventure is for 4-6 characters of levels 4-7 using Labrynth Lord core rules and includes a players map of the area.

194340.name: Landslide (ICONS)
194340.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thugs never think about the consequences of their actions. When the thugs attacked Darius, they had no idea they would unleash a landslide of terror upon them. They also had no idea that they would be crafting a better class of criminal. Darius would show them all. Punks and want-to-be heroes alike would have to face the power of Landslide!

194341.name: Quartermaster
194341.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains the quartermaster base class.

The quartermaster is a mundane class based on skills, but plays more like a wizard than a rogue, constantly staying one step ahead of the enemy. With unparalleled flexibility, they always have just the item needed, and alter each situation to their own benefit. A quartermaster improvises new uses for gear, and fakes advanced materials and alchemical devices. Their skills turns the enemy's devices against them and battlefield into one big hazard zone. Being well supplied never was this good!

194342.name: Modern Bistro
194342.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 24 x 20 inch Battlemap of a Modern Bistro , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.1

“Haunted? I don’t think so sir. Cups don’t move and empty on their own. I think you may have had too much liqueur in your coffee.”—Bistro Server

Modern Bistro is a single level interior map of a coffee shop and restaurant. There is a bit of the exterior sidewalk shown on the map.

Modern Bistro is intended for use in modern games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Espressogeist: A poltergeist haunts the local bistro. The locals tell tales of strange flickering lights at the bistro when it is closed, the sounds of machines turning on and the slamming of doors being opened and shut. During store hours, some patrons swear that they see their cups moved and the contents of their cups emptied. It never seems to happen to the tea drinkers who visit the bistro.

The poltergeist is the ghost of a former owner of the bistro who hates the modernization of his antique bistro and is trying to drive customers away. Unfortunately for the poltergeist, not only does the place serve the best coffee in town, the latest owner has smartly hired four of the prettiest women in town to be the baristas and as a result it’s more popular than ever. The poltergeist is also still obsessed with coffee and rages at night when there is no one there to make it (as he has no idea how to work the espresso machine) and steals sips during the day.

The poltergeist goes away if the modern machines are all removed and they go back to the old ways of making coffee and preparing food.

The player characters can get involved by this being a place they stop by to relax. While there one of them notices their cup moving and the coffee being sucked upward and then vanishing in midair. They might want to investigate the strange happenings further. Perhaps they try to sneak into the place in the middle of the night after observing the flickering lights and noises inside the place when it is closed. They could also be ghost hunters here to capture the poltergeist for the owners or ghost chasers trying to get the poltergeist on camera for proof.

194343.name: The Northlands Saga Complete (Swords & Wizardry)
194343.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deliver us, O Lord, from the fury of the Northmen . . .

Wyrd is fate, and fate is inexorable beneath the leaden winter skies of the Northlands. Where raging storms, some sent by malevolent spirits of the Ginnungagap, howl from the Far North and bury steadings and towns alike under several feet of snow while unnamed things of tooth and shadow hunt those who dare to emerge and brave the cold. Where the blood of fighting men and women sings in harmony with the death cries of the spear-din and the clash of wood and steel when the shield walls meet. Where enchantments older than the race of Men linger in barrow fields and primeval forests waiting to ensnare the unwary or the foolish. This is the realm of the Norns where they measure and cut the threads of a man’s wyrd. This is the Northlands.

A Howl From The North

The Northlands Saga Complete picks up where the Northlands Saga series of adventures released in 2010 and 2011 left off. Created by fan favorite author Kenneth Spencer, these four adventures first introduced Frog God Games fans to the barbaric Northlands, the stalwart folk who dwell there, and the perils, from savage beast and demon alike, that they face. Now The Northlands Saga Complete updates and expands those original adventures with new material and completes the saga with six more new adventures that follow directly after, so GMs can resume campaigns that were left off after the last adventure was released in 2011.

In addition, an eleventh new adventure was added as a prequel to the original four to complete an entire adventure path to take PCs from level 1 to 20. You can play any or all of the eleven adventures as standalone sessions, or you can use them as a single continuous campaign to explore the Northlands and beyond.

As a part of the Lost Lands campaign world, The Northlands Saga Complete incudes a full-color poster map as well as a complete campaign guide detailing the cultures, history, races, nations, languages, geography, and new monsters, magic, and equipment unique to those lands. There is also a chapter dedicated to new optional rules that you can use in your game to capture the authentic spirit of the Northlands with rules for things like a character’s wyrd, death speeches, becoming a jarl, the examples of early representative politics in the Things and Althing, and trial by combat in the holmgang. In addition there are a multitude of new archetypes, feats, player-character races, and character traits. When you delve into The Northlands Saga Complete, you step into the Northlands.

Take your wyrd by the throat. With The Northlands Saga Complete you can break a shield wall on trampled fields or pull a sweep upon gray icy seas to find new shores to explore or raid. Live the adventure; complete the saga!

194344.name: The Further Adventures of the Good Ship Shenandoah!
rpg: The Further Adventures of the Good Ship Shenandoah!
194344.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light science fiction game have eight Traits (somewhat like a fusion of Attributes and Skills) including: Aim, Dodge, Fighting, Grit, Hide and Sneak, Know Things, Notice Things, and Psionics. Traits have a Rating from 1-8, distributed from a standard array of 1-8. Characters also have an Edge and a Drawback, in addition to Hit Points (a derived value). The basic resolution mechanic is a modified 2d6 roll, exploding on 12.

194345.name: Trapped! (2005)
194345.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are created after the collaborative creation of the setting and scenario. Characters are thus created with a niche role in mind. Characters have Attributes, with a numeric Score, including: Brave, Sexy, Clever, Fast, Dangerous, and Lucky. Characters also define relationships, also with a numeric score.

194346.name: Waxing Lyrical
194346.description:
User summary:

Character creation follows an intriguing process of selecting a song the player likes, obtaining the song lyrics, and then deconstructing them into character components. The character that emerges is based, therefore, on a song and also on the player's interaction with that song.

194347.name: Yakuza Armageddon
194347.description:
User summary:

Character creating involves selecting Descriptors ("single word descriptions of your character") and then assigning points. Characters have four positive points ("+") and two negative points ("-"). Characters also have two positive points that must apply to a single combat Descriptor. Task resolution uses a simple card mechanic along the lines of the well-known casino game blackjack.

194348.name: Fields of Blood
194348.description:
From publisher blurb:

The endless fields of waving grains and scrub brush—many see them as featureless wastes, places to be crossed in a journey with little to catch the eye or divert the attention, but these vast seas of grass play home to many terrible beasts, deadly challenges, and amazing tales all hiding just beneath the thin veneer of featureless expanses. Fields of Blood takes a close look at these lands often taken for granted as realms of excitement and mystery and injects them with new life.

With cultural elements and traditions taken from the American Great Plains, the African Savannah, and the Mongolian Steppes, Fields of Blood provides new rules for plains environments, hazards, travel, skills and feats, equipment, monsters, deities, spells, and archetypes. In addition, Fields of Blood includes three ready-to-play adventures for introducing your players into the endless expanse of the grassy sea with “Feast of Fury”, “Red Wedding”, and “Madness Grows”.

Fields of Blood provides rules and options for any plains campaign. While its adventures can easily be set in any plains campaign, they are, however, official Lost Lands setting adventures intended for characters of levels 1–7+. They include plains terrain, dungeon, and village encounters and are written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

194349.name: All Growed Up
194349.description:
User summary:

Characters have three Attributes: Rebellion, Suburbia, and Self-Hatred. Respectively associated with these three Attributes are three archetypal actions: act out, accept normality, and hurt yourself. Each Attribute has an associated dice pool which grows during play. Players attempt to balance the number of dice in each pool so their character grows up "normally". Play proceeds in rounds, with each round representing one year in the life of the teenage characters. Play begins at 13 years of age and ends after seven rounds, on the 19th birthday.

194350.name: Cyclopean Deeps Volume II (Swords & Wizardry)
194350.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Under Realms below the Lost Lands!

Volume 2 of the epic “sandbox” region started in Cyclopean Deeps Volume 1. This series of adventures, by ENnie-award-winning author Matt Finch, continues and completes the Cyclopean Deeps mini-campaign set in the deep and deadly Under Realms below Rappan Athuk.

194351.name: The Solus Project
194351.description:
The Solus Project is a survival adventure game, in which the player controls an astronaut on a mission to save mankind. His spacecraft crashes on an uncharted planet, Gliese-6143-C. He has to survive on the planet and faces factors such as hunger level, thirst, body temperature or weather conditions. The player explores the planet full of temples and other interesting places.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Solus Project", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

194352.description:
Iron League Junior is a version of the Iron League first Edition board game for kids.
This version was made for parents and kids who have never played with board games before or parents and kids who have thought that the Iron League First Edition rules were very difficult.

Year 2100, the world industry has focused on war machines called IRONS and countries compete to have the best robot Iron teams.
Laboratories look for the best weapons and clubs look for the best pilots.
Countries fight in the famous and hardest league in the world: the IRON LEAGUE.
And there are hundreds of teams that fight in each country to compete in the Iron League.
You are an Iron team coach and you have been hired to take the team to victory and win the Iron League title.
Management and sponsors place their trust in you; we know you are the best and you will take the team to victory.
The decisions related to the selection of your team and of your cards, together with the luck of the dice and of the events cards will be decisive to be able to win or lose.
Score more times with the plasma ball than the opposing team; you can also damage all the rival Irons or hit them with the plasma ball to win points.

The game is for 2-6 players.
Recommended for 2 players; if you have 2 Iron League games you can join them together and create a fantastic game.
Recommend age: 7 years up.
Objective of the game
The aim of the game is to have fun! To win the game you must score higher than the opposite team.
The team that manages to put the plasma ball into the goal area 3 times will win.
194352.name: Iron League Junior

194353.name: Attack of the Giant Rats
194353.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves selecting a pre-rat-invasion Profession and dividing a point pool into Attributes (Physique, Psyche, Profession). Attributes numeric ratings are between one and six. Optionally, characters may identify a Mutant Power. Each Attribute also may have an optional Specialty (somewhat like a Skill). Action resolution uses a simple dice pool with multiple success counts possible.

194354.name: Cosmic Criminals
194354.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are heroes in the galaxy and there are villains. Contained within are five dangerous criminals designed to threaten galactic heroes. They are murders, bounty hunters, and thugs who work for the powerful syndicates. Can your heroes defeat the Cosmic Criminals?

194355.name: Bevy of Blades
194355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bevy of Blades contains 4 classes designed by Brian Moran.
Each of these classes centers on the summoning and use of a specific blade and the quirks that go with it.

The Aether Blade forms his weapon from the raw magic around him. His force of personality allows him to produce a myriad of with different auras. The ability to meld his blade with an item, also allows for him to bond with a wand, staff, or rod.

Light shining upon all things is always mirrored by a darkness. Pulling from its effects the Shadow Blade uses this shapeless form to her advantage. Able to strike unexpectedly from the shadows, she learns shroud secrets of the past and conjurers dark revelations.

Nature calls to rangers and druids to protect and serve the wilds, while a Verdant Blade is a blessed champion of nature. Given the secrets of the woad weapon, she discovers various types of seeds that can grow into different effects. Fused with nature, she is able to temporary create makeshift items and harness the power of a treant.

With his sanguineous sword, a Vital Blade draws his power from his own blood. He gains the ability to store excess blood to form a blood pool, which in turn fuels natural born talents. Harnessing his blood allows the vital blade take advantage of the many options granted from his weeping weapon ability.

This product contains 20 pages consisting of: 4 Martial classes with the unique ability to use specialty weapons in new ways, archetype for each of the new base classes, feats, and even favored racial trait options.

194356.description:
The Paradox Premium Wood Disc Upgrade is a set of 155 double-side screen printed, premium hardwood energy discs that can fancily stand in for the cardboard discs included with the game. It includes the same distribution of discs as the standard cardboard ones:

150 Energy discs: 10 (9 plus a spare) of each combination of the 5 colors (white, blue, red, yellow, black) and 3 symbols (+, ▵, ○)
5 Trigger discs (purple)
194356.name: Paradox: Premium Wood Disc Upgrade

194357.name: The Bowls of the Oith
194357.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heap is tasked with protecting a penitent pilgrim as he journeys across the Incredibly Huge Monstertm on a mission to absolve himself of sins at the Bowls of the Oith.

Contains 25 individual 8.5"x11" sheets of non-stop action for use with the Low Life role-playing game using the Savage Worlds gaming system.

Includes a NEW MONSTER, the Holy Mutha!

194358.name: Pixies on Parade (5E)
194358.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pixie Parade is a time-honored event, drawing tourists to the small town of Glavost every year. For these peaceful folk it is a grand feast and excuse for fun, but centuries of tradition leave the origins shrouded in mystery. The citizens are soon to discover all their fairy tales are true.

A brave group of pixies keep the Nightmare King at bay as part of an ancient pact. Now, the bogeyman sets his heir against the defiant fey. When the long-lost boy returns home to lead a final parade, only the town’s children have a hope of victory. Can they turn the fey lord’s magic against him? Can they stand against fear and free an innocent boy?

Pixies on Parade is a stand-alone 5th Edition adventure for 1st - 6th level characters recommended for all ages.

194359.name: Pike (Supers!)
194359.description:
From publisher blurb:

World's Most Wanted helps you get to the fun faster with pregenerated villains and adventure hooks.

Pike is an amoral super mercenary who uses advanced alien technology to take out his prey.

194360.name: No Strings Attached
194360.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep within a shack at the heart of the Bayou, a deadly war rages over which animated voodoo puppet will retain control over the Swamp Witch’s toy chest. The two leading sides in the conflict have fallen into a stalemate, but now, the balance of power will be shifted by the arrival of new puppets... puppets that look an awful lot like the Fated...

No Strings Attached is a fun One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game.

194361.name: Small Mercy
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
194361.description:
From publisher blurb:

The scion of a wealth family is missing, and the team has been hired to bring him home. The trail of his disappearance will lead them across the Main Belt, and pit the team against corporate conspiracies, crazed cultists, trigger-happy mercenaries and bioengineered horrors.

But when the team finally tracks down the wayward son, will they be able to bring him back? Or will they let him disappear in the vastness of space? Just how far is the team willing to go to claim a paycheck? And what are they willing to become?

Shadows Over Sol: Small Mercy is an adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol. It features a tense investigative horror scenario, and is designed to run anywhere between one and three gaming sessions.

194362.name: OneDice Pulp: The Thousand-Headed Man
194362.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the streets of London to the jungles of Indo-China, our intrepid heroes must fight through the mooks and minions of a mysterious mastermind to a confrontation with the Thousand-Headed Man himself!

194363.name: Cutthroat
194363.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are either "Bikers" or "Girlfriends". Characters have a single Stat (Attribute) called Stat. The value is randomly generated by 2d6. Bikers also have Traits including Bike, Girlfriend, Talent, Secret, and Vice. Girlfriends have Talent, Vice, Leash, and Desire. Opposed actions are resolved by a simple dice mechanic. Characters spend their time being violent, chasing girlfriends, and trying to make other characters look foolish so that they alone can be the "top dog".

194364.name: Thinktangles!
194364.description:
Is it really there.. and can you find it?

This is similar to Dobble in that there is a set of cards (of different shapes) with symbols, words and shapes on them. The difference is that there is a second set of cards which have descriptions of objects on them:

"Something that has a tail"

Against the timer each player has to determine if there is an item that matches the description or not.

To make things even more complicated there are also 2 dice which determine which shaped cards you are using in the round.

194365.name: On Ne Vit que Six Fois
194365.description:
User Summary

An (official) French adventure module for Paranoia (1st Edition), for PCs of Red to Yellow credentials.

After having neutralized a traitor, the PCs will have to locate a missing person, and they have a limited time. But [REDACTED]

194366.name: Misfits For Hire
194366.description:
Each player represents a claimant to the Throne of Vintha'las. The King, in his wisdom has decided that the claimants shouldn't have a civil war to figure out who wins. No, they should prove their mettle by besting one of the horrific beasts that wanders the kingdom. One slight problem, the beasts have killed all the legendary heroes, so the claimants will have to make due with...the rest.

The rest are the Misfits, a group of drunken washed up heroes who now haunt the tavern The Drunken Artist, and are your greatest hope for claiming the throne. Here goes nothing!

There are two ways to win. Be the first team to kill the monster, or be the last player standing.

Players draw cards from the community pile as they pursue the big bad monster, sometimes drawing cards that help them, sometimes drawing cards that help the monster. With their hand they discard cards to utilize different types of moves, like attacking the monster or stealing cards from the other groups of misfits questing after the monster as well. Defeat the monster yourself or wait until it devours everyone else, the choice is yours. Whoever lands the last hit gets the kill, so be weary of opportunistic players!

194367.name: Hell's Rebels Pawn Collection
194367.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Key monsters and NPCs from the Hell's Rebels Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with the Hell's Rebels Pawn Collection, featuring more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Hell's Rebels campaign, including cultists, devils, hell hounds, and dozens of unique pawns also suitable for representing player characters. The Hell's Rebels Pawn Collection, together with the creatures from the Pathfinder Pawns: Bestiary Box collections, provides pawns for nearly every Hell's Rebels encounter. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from any of the Bestiary Box collections, making the pawns easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With tons of distinct images, the Hell's Rebels Pawn Collection brings to life the enemies and allies from all six adventures of the Hell's Rebels Adventure Path.


In Hell's Bright Shadow
Turn of the Torrent
Dance of the Damned
A Song of Silver
The Kintargo Contract
Breaking the Bones of Hell

194368.name: Je Suis Karly
194368.description:
Campaign synopsis for Wastburg. Free download from the publisher.

This is an homage to Charlie Hebdo and the attacks of January 2015

(translated) from the Publisher

Karl is a young literate from the Etrave district. He had a good idea. With some friends, Johann, Franz, Bernhart, Filip, Sztefann and Barnard (these last two are loritans), they have had the idea to talk about what is happening in Wastburg, to write or draw it, and then print it on paper and sold for a good price.

The first issues would be free.

The objective of the bilingual paper, title "Karly", a loritanisation of Karl, would be to denounce the abuse from the powerful and the untouchable, as well as the city ambient racism, all on a tone of comedy and humour. Nothing will be sacred.

194369.description:
User summary

WWI is still raging. Enter deeper into the conflict with this supplement:

File 04 is about the year 1915. Rules for hell gases, new powers and magic and rules to manage cells of Skull & Bones

File 05 describe two branches of Skull & Bones.

File 06 include a big adventure in 3 scenarios.

Includes 3 colour maps inside the cover screen.

194371.name: Conan Exiles
194371.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




You are an exile, one of thousands cast out to fend for themselves in a barbaric wasteland swept by terrible sandstorms and besieged on every side by enemies. Here you must fight to survive, build and dominate.

Hungry, thirsty and alone, your very first battle is that against the harsh environment. Grow crops or hunt animals for food. Harvest resources to build weapons and tools. Build a shelter to survive. Ride across a vast world and explore alone, or band together with other players to build entire settlements and strongholds to withstand fierce invasions.

When strong enough, march forth into battle and wage war against your enemies as you fight to dominate the exiled lands. Sacrifice enemy players on the altars of the gods and shift the balance of power your way. Unleash your fury in savage, fast-paced combat and execute bloody and bone-crushing attacks that will see heads rolling and limbs flying.

Source: The Game Website.

194372.description:
Description from the publisher:

Android: Netrunner – 2015 World Champion Corp Deck – Engineering the Future is a card-for-card recreation of the Corp deck played by 2015 Android: Netrunner World Champion Dan D'Argenio, and it features fifty of the strongest cards playable in Haas-Bioroid. These fully tournament-legal cards are collected from the whole of the Android: Netrunner data vault and presented with new full-bleed graphic design and gorgeous extended art, as well as a visually reimagined Engineering the Future identity card.
194372.name: Android: Netrunner – 2015 World Champion Corp Deck – Engineering the Future

194373.description:
Description from the publisher:

Android: Netrunner – 2015 World Champion Runner Deck – Valencia is a card-for-card recreation of the Runner deck played by 2015 Android: Netrunner World Champion Dan D'Argenio, and it features many of the newest and most colorful additions to the Runner's side of Android: Netrunner. Each of its fifty-one tournament-legal cards receives a fantastic, full-bleed treatment with extended art, meaning the deck is almost as much a piece of art as it is a tool that allows you to rip apart Corporate R&D with the greatest of ease.
194373.name: Android: Netrunner – 2015 World Champion Runner Deck – Valencia

194374.name: DK system
194374.description:
User Summary

The first edition of the DK system.

dK System, is the simplest, most unleashed, most modular, funniest (and squarest), most heroic and most fantastic role-playing game system. Based on the success of the Open Gaming License for the d20 System, the dK System offer a simplification of the game mechanics with much more flexibility.

It takes into account the feedback gathered from the players community: more flexible, more fun.

194375.name: Body Bag (Issue 1)
rpgissuearticle: Linceul de poche: L'auberge du pas du bœuf
194375.description:
(Translated) From the cover


Scenario for Plagues DK: Cascades
DK: all the assets
DK: attributes and skills
L'auberge du pas de boeuf (a mini setting)

194376.name: Body Bag (Issue 2)
rpgissuearticle: L'heures des consultations: Entretien avec Samual Tarapacki
Le Nebula, un rade au bout de la galaxie
Neige, première partie: come, come into my world
194376.description:
(Translated) from the cover


Patient 13: Reminiscence
Plagues: Resurrection & the Northern Duchy
Mantel D'Acier: Intro Kit
Final Frontier: The Nebula, a raft on the other side of the Galaxy
Interview: Samuel Tarapacki

194377.name: The Order of the Thorne - The King's Challenge
194377.description:
ABOUT:

Immerse yourself in the story of Finn, a young Bard out to experience life and adventure in the King’s Challenge. Meet your fellow challengers. Experience the wonders of the Faerie Kingdom. Face and overcome danger with the help of your magical lute. Experience the King’s Challenge through the eyes of Finn and help him compose his greatest ballad.

FEATURES:

An original adventure game in a planned anthology series titled 'Order of the Thorne'
Play as Finn the Bard, a brave and cunning songsmith who takes on the King's challenge
Use your lute to perform musical songs to solve puzzles and complete tasks
Hand drawn backgrounds and animations
An original soundtrack with fully voiced characters

THE STORY:

The King of the Fairy Realm, benevolent, wise and respected by his subjects, sat on his throne in the Royal Court in the centre of the great tree. After much deliberation, he proposed a challenge to his subjects and to all those willing; to venture forth on a quest to find his Queen and bring her back to him.
The news of the challenge reached far and wide. With the proclamation announced, champions from many lands took up the call. News of the proclaimation reached even the dusty old corners of an Inn in the neighboring kingdom of Rosette. Finn the Bard, young and headstrong, packed his lute, his songbook and dressed in his travel clothes for the journey to the Fairy Realm.
“The prize for winning the Challenge is not only being the Hero of The Fairy Realm, but the King will grant you one wish of your choosing! I must win – with my wish, I could help benefit all the musicians in all the lands!”
And with that, Finn set out from his room at the Inn, over the mountains, to accept The King’s Challenge.

Source: The Developer Website.

194378.name: Body Bag (Issue 3)
rpgissuearticle: Linceul de poche: comme un putain de conte de Noël
Linceul de poche: Le labyrinthe des fées, un minivers pour le dK
Neige, deuxième partie: c'est une maison bleue
194378.description:
(translated) From the cover


Plagues: Port Syria
Future DK: project snow, part 2
Miniverse: The fairies labyrinth
Hellywood: Like a f***** Christmas tale
Final Frontier: the screen
Final Frontier: the happiness comet
The naked Ludiste

194379.name: Darling Grove
194379.description:
User summary:

All characters in the game are female. Characters primarily are defined by narrative tags and background, including social background, education level, and profession. Characters also have four goals, one in each area: health, wealth, job, and love. Characters determine which other characters they know. Play proceeds with characters trying to meet their goals. Actions requiring resolution result in dice pool rolls to achieve successes. The dice mechanism has a few special cases on certain results.

194380.name: Body Bag (Issue 4)
rpgissuearticle: Linceul de Poche: Cours d’ingénierie des Mantels
Neige, troisième partie : I shot the sherrif
194380.description:
(translated) from the cover


Plagues: Port Syria, the factions
Future Dk: Part 3: I shot the sheriff
Final Frontier: the strips
Hellywood: Inspirations
Final Frontier: Out of time episode 01 and 02
Mantel d'Acier: Mantels engineering classes

194381.name: Fink
194381.description:
From the introduction:

Fink is a game of social unpleasantness. It is about manipulative back-stabbing performed by "friends" upon supposed "friends". The core idea of the game is to be as nasty as possible to the people around you – both game-master controlled characters and those of fellow players – while preserving the illusion of amicability and common values. The characters ruin their fellows’ lives, but the players stay friendly with one another.

rpg: Get Out Get Away Get Wise Get Back Get Even
194382.name: Get Out Get Away Get Wise Get Back Get Even
194382.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are developed during play, by the narrative process. Some characterization may be provided by drawing two game cards from a custom card deck (included as a print-and-play component in the rules), though the main function of these cards is to set up the scenario. Players take turns being the active protagonist; all other players assume the role of antagonists.

194383.name: Guilt and Frustration
194383.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game all male and are defined by Relationships and Characteristics. Relationships function somewhat like Attributes in other games - each character has four (Mother, Father, Girlfriend, and Boss). Each Relationship also has an Expectation and a conflicting Desire, both narrative tags. Every Expectation and Desire has an associated numeric rating, distributed from two points pools. Characteristics are areas of expertise, and each character may select three. Conflict resolution uses a modified d20 roll compared to a target difficulty.

194384.name: Dragon Alchemy
194384.description:
User summary:
This is an alchemy style game that has a player combining dragons rather than elements. The game includes 100 different dragons to find.

194385.name: Paws and Padlocks
194385.description:
The evil Slime Queen has stashed her most valuable treasures within her fortress known as Slime Castle. This has attracted many adventurers from far and wide, including yourself, to try and nab her majesty’s treasures! Will you be quick enough to get your treasure and escape before everyone else, or will you be trapped inside Slime Castle forever?

OVERVIEW
The adventurers are using keys produced by their Magic Key Ring to explore the castle. They hope to collect Krystal Keys, the only keys that can unlock the rooms holding all of the Queen’s treasure.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
The object of the game is to steal one of the Queen’s four treasures and be the first player to escape Slime Castle.

194386.name: Trivial Pursuit - Silver Anniversary Coffee Table Edition
194386.description:
An update to the original Trivial Pursuit (1981).

While the core of Trivial Pursuit is still found in the 25th Anniversary Edition, there are a few differences from the original board game.

The original six categories are still used: Geography, Entertainment, History, Art & Literature, Science & Nature, Sport & Leisure.

Each category now has its own card, with six questions and three difficulty levels.
What you roll determines the level of difficulty of the question.
A roll of one or two results in an easy question, three or four a medium question, and five or six a hard question.
Play in the middle of the board is just like the 1981 version where you roll the die move your scoring token that number of spaces and try to answer a question in an attempt to roll again or in a special case win a wedge of the corresponding color.

Over 2500 new questions 3 Levels of play - now everyone can compete! Raised wood game-board with decorative feet.

The object of the game is still to win all 6 wedges and answer one final question in the center of the board.

The biggest difference of this new version is the addition of an outside track which you move a 2nd playing piece of the same color around.

If you get a question correct you get to move your pawn a certain number of spaces depending on the difficulty of the question answered.

If your pawn lands in one of the four "specialty zones" you are granted a special power used either to help your chances to win the game or hurt your opponents.
These zones are the Face-Off Zone, the Slow it Down Zone, The Easy Cheesy Zone, and Freebie Zone.

194387.name: DREIst!
194387.description:
A small card game where you have cards from 1-8 in 4 colors. You have Aid cards from 1-8 laid out in the center of the table and play cards below those cards (corresponding to the number on the help cards).
You try to lay out 3 cards in a row (i.e. 2-4 same color) or column (1,1,1 in 3 different colors). If you manage to lay down the third card you can draw another card from the stack. When laying down cards you have to lay down 2 together when you start something new in the centre of the table. When adding you can put down just 1 card to already played cards on the table.
If you play your hand empty in one turn, you can put 2 cards of your stack on top of another players stack. The first player with an empty stack wins.

110 cards
1 rulesheet

194388.name: Blacksmith Brothers
194388.description:
Description from the publisher:

Blacksmith Brothers is a game in which players play the role of two brother master blacksmiths who seek glory in the Kingdom of Hammer Stones. The King goes in search of the best blacksmiths of his kingdom, and now you compete to show off your skills in the forge.

Players must allocate their two meeples in specific constructions to collect resources, carry them to their warehouse to be forged, and sell the goods to nobles who will give you special abilities and victory points. When the King returns to his castle, the brothers with the most points win the match and will be hired as official blacksmiths of the Kingdom.

From the publisher (Portuguese):
Blacksmith Brothers é um jogo onde os jogadores fazem o papel de dois irmãos mestres ferreiros que buscam glória no Reino de Hammer Stones. O Rei sai em busca dos melhores ferreiros do seu reino e compete à você mostrar suas habilidades na forja.
Os jogadores devem alocar seus dois meeples em construções específicas do tabuleiro para coletar recursos, transporta-los para seu armazém para serem forjados e vendidos aos nobres que irão lhe presentear com habilidades especiais e pontos de vitória.
Quando o Rei voltar ao seu castelo, os irmãos com mais pontos vencem a partida e serão contratados como ferreiros oficiais do Reino.

194389.name: The Princess Bride Scwamble Game
194389.description: The Princess Bride Scwamble Game resembles a certain other word-creation game with a similar name as players take turns putting wooden letter tiles on a grid in order to score points, but in addition to the normal words one might find in the dictionary, players can also score for spelling "mawage", "togeder", and "foweva" as well as iconic phrases such as "Tru Wuv".

194390.name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Queen Expansion
194390.description:
From the publisher:
Queen, monarch, profanities, no matter what you call her the xenomorph queen inspires terror wherever she goes. Inspiring Drones and Soldiers with hive intelligence she can turn a colony thousands strong into chestburster food in mere weeks. And if you are foolish enough to enter her lair, your screams as she rips you apart will be the last sounds you ever make.

194391.name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Crusher Expansion
194391.description:
From the publisher:
The Crusher caste encountered on Acheron (LV-426) Still remains a mystery to USCM. No obvious host of Origin can be determined, originally presumed to be an Adolescent Queen this theory was quickly dismissed.
The Crushers large head crest, which at this time is believed to be bulletproof, Becomes the Prime Weapon of Choice, Charging its prey to inflict massive blunt force trauma.

194392.description:
Released July 8, 2016 - 3 months ahead.

MOSCOW '41 is a light/medium wargame covering the German Army Group Centre offensive aimed to seize Moscow, after having successfully defeated several Soviet armies in the great encirclement battles at the frontier and established two bridgeheads on the Dnieper.

Although based on a historical event, the two players can modify the course of the operations, with the Germans trying to achieve a decisive victory before the winter comes, and the Soviets playing a fighting withdrawal, until ready to strike a decisive blow at the invaders.

The game is recommended for two players, but has excellent solitaire suitability.

Historical Introduction

"At the beginning of each campaign, one pushes a door into a dark, unseen room. One can never know what is hiding inside."

- Adolf Hitler, June '41

In December of 1940, Hitler made the decision to invade Russia and set the date for the middle of 1941. He had good reason to be confident that Russia would collapse under an uncompromising assault. Since the outbreak of hostilities, the German Wehrmacht had accomplished a stunning and unparalleled series of victories: Poland had fallen in one month, Denmark in one day; France, till then regarded as the strongest power in Europe, had capitulated in under six weeks, Holland in under six days; Belgium, Norway, Yugoslavia and Greece took less than three weeks each. The German military might was at its peak and the word Blitzkrieg had entered the language.

Russia, on the other hand had taken over three months to bring Finland to heel, despite overwhelming strength of numbers. The Russian army had not yet recovered from Stalin's purges of 1937-1938 where 400 generals were “removed” including three field marshals and 13 Army commanders. It was well that Hitler could say, “Before three months have passed, we shall witness a collapse in Russia, the like of which has never been seen in history. We have only to kick in the front door and the whole rotten Russian edifice will come tumbling down.”

On the 22nd of June, 1941, Operation Barbarossa - the invasion of Russia, began. Three million Axis troops in three Army Groups attacked on a front that stretched from the Baltic to the Black Sea: Army Group North under Field Marshal von Leeb was tasked with taking Leningrad; Army Group South under Field Marshal von Rundstedt was to capture Kiev and seize the Caucasus; Field Marshal von Bock's Army Group Centre, the one that concerns us, had Moscow as an objective, with Timoshenko undertaking the task of defending the capital.

Initially, the operation succeeded beyond Hitler's wildest dreams. Within a day, the Russian Air Force was destroyed on the ground, then vast inroads were made on all fronts accompanied by large scale surrenders of encircled Russian troops. Army Group Centre with its four armies consisting of a total of 48 Divisions, of which nine were armoured, and backed by the Second Air Fleet, had reached the outskirts of Smolensk by the 15th July. This was two-thirds of the way to Moscow and it seemed that nothing could stop von Bock from blowing up the Kremlin within another three or four weeks... or could something stand in his way?

Four things could now cause problems to von Bock: firstly, his supply line is stretched and had almost reached breaking point; secondly, Russian resistance is stiffening; thirdly, his infantry divisions are having difficulty keeping up with the Panzers and finally, a new Russian ally is about to enter the field: General Winter.

Additional concerns may come in November, with three-quarters of a million experienced Siberian veterans freed by garrisoning Soviet Far East, thanks to Stalin's spies in Tokyo revealing Japanese intentions to attack America, and not Russia.

As the German Commander, you must push on to Moscow before it is too late. As the Russian Commander you must re-evoke the Patriotic War and stop the invaders at any cost.
194392.name: Moscow '41

194393.name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Royal Guard Expansion
194393.description:
From publisher:
Strongest and most feriocius of them all are known to guard Queen herself.

194394.name: Alien vs Predator: Power Loader Expansion
194394.description:
From the publisher:
Caterpillar P-5000 Powered Work Loader, commonly referred to as a Power Loader.
This useful piece of equipment can be found at most human colonies.
Primarily used to lift and relocate heavy objects the power loader is a true asset to Human engineering and infrastructure.
You can watch that puppy scream as you throw it out an air lock.

194395.name: Alien vs Predator: Predator Hellhound Expansion
194395.description:
From the publisher:
The Hellhounds are a canine-like species domesticated by the Predators for use in hunting.
Much like The Bloodhounds of Earth they are used to chase down prey allowing a swifter, more effective hunt to be executed. That said the Predators have also been known to release the hellhounds with intent to cause panic and thin the ranks of their opponents during battle."

194396.name: White Star Companion
194396.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Galaxy Just Got Bigger!

Daring Men of Tomorrow and intrepid Deep Space Explorers face off against a horde of savage White Simians in the floating jungle of a lost world. Plucky Sidekicks escape relentless Bounty Hunters aboard their modified skyboards. Somewhere on the edge of the galaxy, an Orbital Battle Station is about to obliterate an entire planet with the push of a button.

The White Star Companion brings nearly one hundred pages of new options to your White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying experience. New classes, new aliens, new creatures, new weapons, and new starships are all revealed. Complete rules for planetary vehicle combat are provided along with ways to generate complete star systems simply by rolling a few dice. The brand new skill and Serial systems can instantly flesh out a character's history and talents.

With the White Star Companion, you'll expand your game to the edge of the galaxy and beyond! White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying is completely compatible with Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox and many other old-school roleplaying products.

194397.name: Hastilion Expanse
194397.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Welcome to the Mercenary Breed campaign set, Hastilion Expanse. Hastilion Expanse is a space opera campaign designed for Mercenary Breed, presenting the campaign and supporting it with source material, character options, and new adversaries inside and outside of the campaign.

The Hastilion Expanse is a 12-part plot point campaign, taking the characters from Novice through Legendary. It includes:

New Character Options
New Adversaries
A detailed look at the Hastilion Expanse
Novice through Heroic Savage Tales
… and more!

194398.name: The Northlands Saga Complete Player's Guide
194398.description:
From publisher blurb:

Included in The Northlands Saga Complete Player’s Guide are new PC races, class options, and equipment (presented in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules with Swords & Wizardry Complete conversion commentary where needed), optional rules for players on how to handle things like fate and death speeches, eight pre-generated characters making use of some of these new characters rules and options that players can use or simply look at as examples of Northlander character creation, and six new Tales of the Lost Lands stories set in the Northlands that give examples of the kinds of adventures and attitudes that the players are likely to find in the Northlands Saga setting.

All of the rules information in this player’s guide is included in the Northlands Saga Complete as well.

194399.name: Fluxxx: The RPG
194399.description:
From the introduction:

One foolish player volunteers to be the Fluxxxmaster. All other players are Fluxxxers. The Fluxxxmaster thinks up stuff for the Fluxxxers to do. The players make the Fluxxxmaster’s life meaningless by having the Fluxxxers do other stuff. Sometimes the Fluxxxmaster gets to have fun when all the Fluxxxers die at the same time, but usually the other players get to have the fun. However it shakes out, you probably won’t have to be the Fluxxxmaster for long. Don’t worry if you don’t know how to play a roleplaying game because nobody ever knew what they were doing when they first started out. Just make sure you have a twenty-sided dice.

194400.description:
Kacper Ryx i Król Żebraków ("Kacper Ryx and the King of Beggars") is a picaresque board game for 2-5 players, based on the motifs of the novel series about sixteenth-century Cracow detective Kacper (eng. Casper) Ryx written by a Polish writer Mariusz Wollny.

Players assume the role of gangs ringleaders, who fight for the title of the King of Beggars, the ruler of the Cracow underworld. The winner will be the one who at the end of the game will have the highest value of points of influence (respect). The players score points by performing tasks described on the objective cards which they are drawing at the start of each turn. Many objectives will require a capture of taverns, which will become bases of operation for players and will allow to take control over districts of the Renaissance Cracow.

Each turn is divided into 4 phases. In the income phase players collect tribute, fill their ranks with new thugs and draw special cards according to the value provided by each inn they control. They also draw new objectives (3 cards are always kept in hand) and heal each ringleader wounded in the previous turn.
In the action phase players operate on a beautiful board depicting the Cracow from the days of yore. They usually perform 8 basic actions (movement, brawl, stealing, begging, murder, trade, bribery, recruitment) and use special action cards. All 8 basic actions are printed on four 2-sided cards, one on each side. Each player has his own set of cards. At any given moment a player can perform only the action that is visible to him, that's why players must always plan on how and when to use their basic actions in order to fulfill their secret objectives in the best way possible. Each action has its cost in the form of ducats (game currency) and/or action points. A player usually can't spend more than 10 action points per turn. After the action phase comes the objective phase, in which the players reveal each task they did perform in the action phase. For those, they receive points of influence.

Investigation phase is the final step of each turn. At this point, the players reveal investigation cards they previously collected. Those cards are obtained as the result of various crimes conducted in the action phase and simulate the inquiry of the title detective Kacper Ryx. Many of those cards will cost us the loss of money (ducats), thugs or will block any income that our taverns may generate in the coming turn. In addition, the investigation cards are a key factor in ending the game. Each of them will add more points to the investigation pool, common to all players. Investigation Track coincides with the Time Track. With the passage of time and the disclosure of new crimes conducted by players, both the time and investigation marker, which start at the opposing end of the time-investigation track, will move closer to each other. When they meet the game ends and the player who scores most points of influence will be the new King of Beggars.

A 2 players variant follows a somewhat different principles. The map of Cracow is limited to 6 districts, players do not use time/investigation track as well as the influence track. Instead they compete for fulfillment of the 4 explicit objectives drawn from separate "duel deck" set next to the board. Upon completion of a task, the player takes the duel card to his pool and draws new one to replace the one he took. The player who first accumulates 4 objective cards wins the game. Thanks to these modifications the game is as playable as the 3-5 players variant, but much shorter.
194400.name: Kacper Ryx i Król Żebraków

194401.name: World of the Lost
194401.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quicksand, Jungle Rot, and Psychotic Robots

Each year, the citizens of Khirima offer a massive tribute of silver to the demons which dwell within the Temple of Ages That Are Not. To acquire the silver for themselves, the adventurers must face bellowing dinosaurs, plague demons, the horrors which dwell within the Abscess, and a dungeon where memory is an illusion and time is a weapon.

World of the Lost is an adventure for characters levels 1-4, featuring a 200-encounter wilderness hexcrawl, a city sourcebook, a dungeon, quests, diseases, new spells, and new magic items.

194402.name: In Search of the Fluxxx
194402.description:
From the introduction:

This package forms a complete module for use with Fluxxx: The RPG. It is especially designed as an instructional aid for beginning Fluxxxmasters and players, specifically created to enable new Fluxxxmasters to initiate play without an iota of preparation.

In addition to descriptive and situational material, this module also includes special informational sections giving background history and legends, listings of possible monsters and treasures and how to place them, a list of adventuring Fluxxxers tips on various aspects of play for the Fluxxxmasters and helpful advice for starting players.

194403.name: Fluxxx: The RPG, The Collectible Card Supplement
194403.description:
From the introduction:

Includes tracking cards for use during play of Fluxxx: The RPG. While not strictly required by the rules, tracking cards are required by the reality of play. Unless you like a game where everybody is free to flaunt the rules when it suits them.

194404.name: OneDice Spies: Cold War - Men in Red
194404.description:
From publisher blurb:

Men in Red is a brief setting for OneDice Spies: Cold War, set against the backdrop of Cold War Russia, in which an alien race threatens the security of the Motherland. Do you play the KGB agents, trying to find out what's going on, or the desperate aliens, fleeing their dying world and looking for a new home in the Kamchatka Peninsula?

194405.name: Arnhem: Airborne Assault
194405.description:
User Summary

Hex & counter wargame about Operation Market Garden. Has 4 scenarios. Although the game looks like a boardgame, it is not a digital implementation of an existing boardgame

194406.name: Assault on Arnhem
194406.description:
User Summary

Hex & counter wargame about Operation Market Garden. Has 4 scenarios. Although the game looks like a boardgame, it is not a digital implementation of an existing boardgame

This game is the sequel of Arnhem: Airborne Assault

According to the developer Assault on Arnhem is a significant improvement on top of the original game. The list of improvements includes: better AI, Allied AI, complete rebuild of the UI, new artwork, HexWar multiplayer, Mac and PC versions, a tutorial, tooltips, rewritten instructions, balancing, a rewrite of the pathfinding process and a number of other user improvements. To put it into perspective the additional work has taken a year to complete, which is as long as the original game took to write!

Probably most notable is that due to these changes, this new game is now platform independent, meaning you can play versus any other player owning this game, regardless which platform each player uses.

194408.description:
"Despite all our hopes, Earth got depleted before FTL jumps were possible. However, mankind made one last and desperate effort: four colony fleets were sent in a intergenerational journey to four distant systems potentially capable of supporting human life...

...colonists reaching Arcturus found a barren planet. In order to preserve their very existence they established a symbiotic relationship with an alien artifact they found there...

...colonists reaching Draco had to introduce lizard genes into their genome so they could adapt to the new planetary conditions they found...

...colonists reaching Hydra found resources were scarce and chose to genetically become "more efficient" so no one had to be left behind...

...and for the last colony fleet... well, you all know what happened... let's just say we were the lucky ones.

One would think the later invention of the FTL drive presented an opportunity to reunite with our long lost brothers after many centuries... unfortunately, regardless of our many differences, we all were descendants of mankind and thus we all were afflicted by an ancient common curse: war".

-extracted from Lyta Roslin's speech: "The Descendants War"-

Parallax is a 4X game with a heavy focus on the thematic and narrative aspects. In this manner, payers not only maneuver ther fleets to eXplore and eXploit the galaxy, eXterminate other fleets and eXpand their empires, but also decide the fate of the many heroes which take part on it by fallling in love, challenging rival heroes to a duel, fulfilling secret personal agendas or making political speeches among many other things.

More specifically, players will compete for the hegemony of the universe over nine turns with the following structure:

1)PRE-TURN PHASE: Exhausted admirals and commodores are refreshed. Event cards are resolved, thus weaving an immersive story over the nine turns. Additionally, every officer controlled by a player receives a secret agenda which can enhance the stats of that particular officer or even score some VPs when fulfilled.

2)MOVEMENT PHASE: Admirals and commodores spend fuel to strategically move fleets under their command.
