3)ECONOMIC PHASE: Planets are colonized (by force or by political means) and excavated in search of ancient alien technologies. New technologies and ships can be purchased afterwards.

(At any time during phases 2 and 3 players can perform additional actions in their turns, such as “war declaration”, “secret deal”, “auction” or “challenge enemy officer to a duel” by exhausting their officers in order to use their political influence).

4)END-TURN PHASE: Colonized planets produce resources. Turn order is determined for the next turn. In turns 3, 6 and 9 players score VPs according to the planets they control.

Overall, the main goal is to capture the feel of space operas by creating both a narrative and a strategic experience, playable under three hours.
194408.name: Parallax: The descendants War

194411.name: Anaxi
194411.description:
In Anaxi, players are presented with category prompts, and they want to think of words or phrases that fit multiple categories at the same time — but without matching another player's answers.

In each of five rounds, players draw a single blue, red and orange card. These round cards have clear plastic on one-third of them and a word written on the other two-thirds. Players overlap these cards on a scoring chart that shows the value of a word or phrase that encompasses two or three of these categories. Players have a limited amount of time to write down as many words or phrases as they can for each pair of categories and for all three categories. They then compare answers and score points for those answers unique to themselves.

Whoever has the most points after five rounds wins!

194412.name: Spirot
194412.description:
Players in Spirot play pixellated cards from their hands in order to create sequences of three cards that have the same color (or all different colors) as well as the same pixel pattern (or all different pixel patterns).

To set up, place the nine board cards in a 3x3 grid, shuffle the spirot cards, and deal six cards to each player. Reveal spirot cards from the top of the deck until you find a matching image card that can cover each of the four corners of the board card. Each spirot card has one of the nine images on the board cards, with this image in one of three colors and one of three pixel patterns.

On a turn, place a spirot card from your hand onto a board card. If you create a sequence, you score one point, then take another turn. If you don't create a sequence, your turn ends. At the end of your turn, refill your hand to six cards.

Once someone has five points, complete the round so that everyone has had the same number of turns. Whoever has the most points wins!

194413.name: I Think My Girlfriend Hates Me
rpg: I Think My Girlfriend Hates Me
194413.description:
User summary:

This game is written for exactly two players, one of which is designated the game master. The GM controls "The Girlfriend" and other aspects of play, while the sole player controls "The Boy", who is defined as "a pretty run of the mill schmuck" who is completely unable to understand his girlfriend. Even when she's trying to be blunt. Characters have Stats (Attributes), but they are not similar. The Boy has Suspicion and Health, the Girlfriend has Hopelessness and Conspicuousness. These have values that are randomly generated.

194414.name: Melvin + Simon
194414.description: Melvin + Simon is a collage art memory game.

194415.name: January's Frost
194415.description:
User summary:

This unique game is presented as a fusion of fiction and rules interspersed in the document. It presents a system mechanic and a complex setting, though the actual system mechanics are obscure and difficult to extract. Action resolution takes place through the use of dice pools attached to somewhat undefined character traits. The setting has a heavy dreamlike, or fairytale, flavor. The game is not particularly accessible, though the setting is intriguing.

194416.name: Spectracube
194416.description: Spectracube is a set of thirty colored cubes — half featuring primary colors and the other half secondary colors — that can be used to play six games.

194417.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Lucky Dip cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

Zanzibar has two islands and Unguja may be played stand-alone or with Pemba. The boards do not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks. There are flight options as an extra enhancement.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
194417.name: Zanzibar - Unguja (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

194418.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Lucky Dip cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

Zanzibar has two islands and Unguja may be played stand-alone or with Pemba. The boards do not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks. There are flight options as an extra enhancement.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
194418.name: Zanzibar - Pemba (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

boardgameintegration: Big Side
Big Side
194419.description:
"Bigside pocket" is standalone game of bigside. not expansion for bigside*


あなたはオールドボ-ス!
しかし、あなたには信頼を置ける部下がいない。
周りにはあなたの位置を狙う奴、 また、ソイツのために、あなたのことを裏切ろうとする奴らばかり! 奴らを見つけ出し、最後までボスの地位を守り切ろう!

Your are a old boss !
You must be find traitor and new boss !!
That's the way you survive.

Bigside pocket is a party game for multiple people together.One of the players becomes the Old Boss. The other players draw 2 cards. In turn, they use one of the cards. The card left on your hand becomes your identity. There are 8 cards total (2 per each Character) so it is possible to guess others' card. After all players use their own card, the Old Boss chooses a player to find the betrayer. Players get the income according to the result. The game ends after all players once played the Boss. The player with the highest money wins the game.

This game is release 2016 kobe game market.
194419.name: Bigside pocket

194421.name: A Concerned Friend to Her Family
rpg: A Concerned Friend to Her Family
194421.description:
From the Website:

This is a role-playing poem for two players. You will be role-playing two characters who are collaborating on writing a letter. You will need a pen and a blank sheet of paper so that one of you can physically write out the letter in your neatest longhand.

194422.name: Dead Effect 2
194422.description:
One of the most anticipated features is the cooperative multiplayer mode, where the players can go through all game levels and special missions with the help of one or two other players.

Source: The Game Website.

194423.name: King Rat (2005)
194423.description:
User summary:

This diceless role-playing game begins with the collaborative creation of the setting, conceived as a limited, closed society. The setting is referred to as "The Nest". Characters subsequently are created and have various identified traits. An important aspect of the game is the limited nature of resources available in The Next, and one of the primary goals of play is to gain increasing control over the most resources possible.

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
194424.name: Deep Dark Blue
194424.description:
(publisher blurb)

Adventure awaits between the devil and the deep blue sea…

In the near future, when most of the Earth’s land has been stripped of its resources, an intrepid few look to the depths of the oceans for energy and precious metals.

This new frontier carries as many dangers as it does opportunities, including the crushing pressure, colossal squids, and ruthless tactics of your rivals at Quest, Inc. Even your own ship will betray you if you let your energy or oxygen dwindle, threatening your navigation systems, lights, engine, and life support itself.

Survive the depths in Deep Dark Blue, a new Fate World of Adventure by Lore Graham and Mike Olson.

Deep Dark Blue requires Fate Core to play. This 52-page supplement contains:

A crew-based character creation system to help create a cohesive and balanced group
A new teamwork track to represent the effects of stress on group dynamics
Submarine rules for deep sea exploration, combat, and damage
A ship-specific condition system—like consequences, but with specific effects and duration
A short introductory adventure—The Rescue of Dr. Williams

194425.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 485 - Mar 2016)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs From the Editor

194426.name: Mantel d'Acier
rpgissuearticle: Linceul de Poche: Cours d’ingénierie des Mantels
194426.description:
User Summary

Mantel d'Acier is the French adaption of Cloak of Steel to the dK System.

It is a campaign setting for dk System.

The world of Terplane is flat surrounded by uncrossable mountains. The Lurope continent is soaked in magic energy called Mana. This magic energy and mechanisation allow intensive agriculture, large cities and large robots to defend cities against large and powerful monsters.

194427.name: Me and the Rat
194427.description:
User summary:

The game presents a single unified mechanic, setting, and scenario. Characters are pre-defined with specific roles in the game. Characters have limited tokens which can be spent to influence (but not control) the narrative outcome. Opposed actions are resolved by a die roll, possibly modified by tokens.

194428.name: Bestiaire Monstrueux
194428.description:
User Summary

Monstrous bestiary for dK System

52 pages of monsters with pictures, stats and challenge rating for dK System.

194429.name: The Great Rat Raid
194429.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game all are rats. Rats have six Attributes: Scurrying, Thinking, Chittering, Abilities, Crumbs, and Glory. Each Attribute has a numeric score assigned from a point pool. Abilities (assuming a non-zero score) are subsequently randomly generated. Given the characters are rats, Abilities are something like super powers, though not all and absolute benefits. Action resolution utilizes a modified d10 roll to influence narrative outcomes.

There also is a cat in the house, and possibly traps. These elements are managed by group consensus and a few rules.

194430.name: Plagues
194430.description:
User Summary

Plagues is a campaign setting for dK System

The gods abandoned the world of Ordann and the dead spirits stayed... animating this corpse and taking over. Dwarves sealed their cities, Elfs managed to defend some of their forest and humans are trying to survive.

The book describe the former Northern Duchies.

194432.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – B-17
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
194432.description:
From the Publisher:

The Boeing B-17 “Flying Fortress” is a four-engine heavy bomber aircraft developed in the 1930s for the United States Army Air Corps (USAAC). The B-17 was primarily employed in the daylight precision strategic bombing campaign of World War II against German industrial and military targets. From its introduction in 1938, the B-17 Flying Fortress evolved through numerous design advances.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory® Special Pack is a ready-to-play large size model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.

In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards, as well as specific rules and components necessary to use the airplane.

Bonus contents in this pack include one double-sided industrial complex card and special rules.

Comes in a Memphis Belle version and Bit o Lace version.

194433.name: The Rat-God's Girlfriend
194433.description:
User summary:

In the game, one player controls the Rat God character, one player controls the Girlfriend character, and the remaining players control the Chosen. The Chosen can be played collectively or in groups (factions) as desired. Play proceeds with tokens and dice. Tokens can be spent to simply bypass die rolls during narrative conflict. Tokens also can be spent for special effects, depending on which character spends them.

194434.name: The World Class Rats Handbook
194434.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes (called the Big Seven in the game), each with an associated points pool. During play, points are spent to resolve conflict or overcome opposition. The Big Seven are Talk, Stealth, Fight, Info, Sleight, Appearance, and Acrobatics. Characters also may have Specializations, Flair, a Goal, and some Tools of the Trade (not necessarily hardware tools).

194435.name: Sloat and Larkin
194435.description:
User summary:

Characters have four Attributes: Raw Mind, Refined Mind, Raw Body, and Refined Body. Each Attribute has an associated "micro story" (20-50 words) that describe the character's ability in that area. Attributes also have an associated dice pool distributed from a large pool at creation time. During play, characters use dice pools for actions; a result of six is considered a success but a roll of one "exhausts" the die and it is removed from the pool and passes to the game master. Players may determine how many dice from a given pool to use (and thus risk).

194436.description: Quadropolis: Festival International des Jeux is a promotional tile for Quadropolis released to commemorate the 30th International Games Festival in Cannes. It may replace one of the monuments used in the game's expert mode.
194436.name: Quadropolis: Festival International des Jeux

194438.name: SixStix
194438.description: Players in SixStix race to rearrange their sticks to match the patterns shown on cards, and whoever collects the most cards wins!

194439.name: Plastered Road
194439.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 291st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a plastered road through a wintery wasteland.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

194441.name: The World of Myrr
194441.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Myrr was inspired by the classic fantasy RPG settings. It is a highly detailed, 371 page book. Myrr is a great foundation for any 5th Edition adventure and can be used with other fantasy RPGs. More than thirty players have playtested this setting for over a year and a half.

Myrr was known as a peaceful place...not any more...

Various factions have converged on this continent. When they clash it will change the world forever. The vampire's alliance with the devils is the biggest threat to peace. Powerful leaders in the cities of Wyld and Stonehelm are making aggressive moves. The bandit lords of the Southern Territories are threatening to move north. Even the serene, elven Nerathian Kingdom has been infiltrated by dark elf spies. In the Northwest, many are worried about the might of the Barbarian army. Many shadowy thieves and monks are making folk nervous. And then there are the orcs, goblins, giants, and dragons!

However, there is some hope for peace. The true knighthoods stand up to evil, and honor still has its place in the Fighters' Guild. Some wizards on the Wizard Council have their hearts in the right place. The most powerful forces of good might well be the Inner Sons monk brotherhood or the warrior clerics known as the Ro Gard.

The 371 page book includes:

Over 70 detailed settlements (villages, towns, and cities)
Unique lore, with a timeline included
Over 40 adventure hooks
Detailed maps
Detailed geographic features
Thirty new monsters
Over 250 NPC descriptions
A unique pantheon with over 50 deities
Over 50 different factions
43 pages of encounter tables
43 pages of corresponding monster lists, organized by challenge ratings
Over 300 detailed inns and taverns
Tavern menu list

194442.name: Game Master's Guide World of Myrr
194442.description:
From publisher blurb:

A practical guidebook for any Game Master. Need more monsters? Interested in some helpful tips? Need more tables to add depth to your fantasy RPG? This guide contains all of that and more.

The 136 page book includes:

An update to the Myrr new monster collection/now over 50 monsters
Over 30 pages of new encounter tables and new monster lists
30 Game Master tips
Stats for all the Notable Characters from the campaign book
A new map of Myrr
Critical Hit and Miss tables
An alternate Wild Magic table
Chase tables
Random items tables

194443.name: Liber Xpansion
194443.description:
From publisher blurb:

Liber Xpansion contains supplemental material that expands upon Liber Influxus Communis, giving players and GMs even more toys to adapt overcome and survive.

In this (currently 25 pages) Work-In-Progress document you'll find:

Ultimate Psionic Options: The Musha-chie (mystic archetype) and the Syphon (an alternate conduit base class)!
Expanded Archetypes: More archetypes for the Battle Lord, Metamorph, Mnemonic, more!
New Material, including evolutions, new mystic talents, taboos, twisted spirits and feats.

194444.name: Occult Spells
194444.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spells Secret and Strange!

Mythic Magic: Occult Spells brings you you 129 all-new mythic spells from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Occult Adventures! While the original mythic rules for Pathfinder included many cherished favorites from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook as well as the other core rules hardback rulebooks and the Mythic Spell Compendium compiled a vast array of mythic spells for your game, new rules for Pathfinder continue to come out and spellcasters have a continual supply of new tricks to try from more recent rulebooks. If you like occult mysteries and psychic magic, this is the book for you as it completes the mythic rules for every spell in Pathfinder Roleplaying Occult Adventures. All of them, from akashic form to withdraw affliction and all spells in between.

Whether you’re a true psychic spellcaster or a user of arcane or divine magic who simply dabbles in the world of spirits and psychics,Mythic Magic: Occult Spells contains mythic spells of every level and every kind, from minor spells to the mightiest magics. You will find combat spells like id insinuation, synaptic overload, and explode head right alongside defensive magic like sealed life and tower of iron will, spells to aid your allies like dream voyage and contagious zeal, and utility spells like akashic form, create mindscape, andbilocation! Grab this book today and make the occult Legendary!

194445.name: Path of the Reluctant Hero
194445.description:
From publisher blurb:

From Humble to Hero!

Path of the Reluctant Hero provides over 80 amazing mythic path abilities and reluctant heroics to help build characters that may not see themselves as heroes, but whose sheer grit and determination can see them through any challenge. They will not bow or break, they will not give up on protecting the home and hope they hold dearest to their hearts, and they will never forget that what they are fighting for peace and freedom, home and happiness matters more than anything. Whether your reluctant hero is a homebody or simple farmer, an orphan or retired hero, a denier of destiny or a scoundrel with a heart of gold, you'll find all manner of abilities designed to help you tap into unknown reservoirs of strength like rise to the occasion, unflinching, he ain't heavy, and hold onto hope, and may tap into the breadth of their experience with abilities like heirloom, one step ahead, or curse-bearer. A reluctant hero may get through with guile and luck with accidental observation, shot in the dark, lucky guess, and right place, right time, but she's equally adept at applying the keen insights of everyday wisdom with common sense, learning by example, trusty tools, and ever practical. A reluctant hero may seem harmless due to abilities like obscurity, cautious, innocent bystander, and I'm getting too old for this, but when disaster looms a reluctant hero may snatch from death, use everything, or declare that's not fair! or you shall be avenged! Whether your hero traces his roots to simple peasant life, long-faded glory, or a lineage that haunts his destiny, you'll find a wealth of ideas to make your reluctant heroes truly legendary!

194446.name: Path of Villains
194446.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's So Good to be Bad!

Villains are key figures in establishing the story of a world, but great villains are more than just statistics. Path of Villains brings you essential advice on creating and staging your villain, crafting a personality and theme that will make your players hate this guy's guts, creating their motivation, method, and means of being bad and marking every malevolent milestone along the way. On top of that, Path of Villains also offers a wealth of mechanical options to keep your villains one step ahead of the heroes, always prepared for your players and their dirty tricks, and even when they fall it's never the end. Path of Villains supplements the mythic ranks and tiers introduced in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Mythic Adventures and introduces a brand-new villain path, filled out with almost three dozen brand-new mythic path abilities from apparent demise to your children's children. Craft legendary and memorable villains with a blood pact or subtle chains of bondage, menace your heroes with bloodtheft and anunspeakable name, and make sure your villain is prepared for the worst as a clone arranger, undying hatred, or back from the grave. If you want to create villains that can stand up to mythic heroes and leave an indelible mark on your campaign, pick up Path of Villains and Make Your Game Legendary!

194447.name: Sovrano
194447.description:
The game of Sovrano is a straight-forward and easy to learn game of strategy and cunning. However, beneath the relative simplicity lies a depth of complexity that will keep the game interesting and re-playable.

Assemble your guards and prepare to lead your emperor to the throne and absolute power!

Sovrano is a game for two players that typically lasts between 15 to 30 minutes. Each player has 11 pieces (1 Emperor, 8 Guards, 2 Archers). The center space of the board is the Throne, while on opposite ends of the center row lie the Tower-spaces.

The objective of the game is to be the player who scores the most points by capturing the Tower-spaces (1 point granted per space held at the start of each turn).

The second objective of Sovrano is to be the first player to move their Emperor onto the center space (the Throne-space) and hold it until the start of his or her next turn. This grants that player 3 points and ends the game.

194448.name: Yalla
194448.description:
Yalla is a very simple to learn and quick playing abstract strategy micro card game which can be played with two, three, or four players.

Yalla is great for the whole family because children as young as first and second grade can competitively play the game.

Two or four players, one player or team playing black and one player or team playing white, alternate placing twelve cards per player to the table. The goal of the game is to achieve the larger point value based on a combination of the number of contiguous squares controlled after all cards are played combined with the number of points scored forming solid four-square areas called "Yallas". The player with the higher combined total point value wins the round. A game may consist of several rounds, which alternate player turn order, so as to achieve an agreed winning point total threshold.

194449.name: Winter's Teeth (Swords & Wizardry)
rpgseries: The Northlands Series: The Long Night of Winter
194449.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter’s Teeth is an adventure for the Northlands Saga setting and is the first adventure in The Long Night of Winter adventure anthology. Like the other adventures in the anthology, Winter’s Teeth is intended to be dropped into a Northlands Saga campaign by the GM/Referee at any time or place that is convenient. It is not, therefore, tied to any particular location in the Northlands or to any specific time beyond occurring in the depths of winter.

Swords & Wizardry character level: 4-5

194450.name: Winter's Teeth (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: The Northlands Series: The Long Night of Winter
194450.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter’s Teeth is an adventure for the Northlands Saga setting and is the first adventure in The Long Night of Winter adventure anthology. Like the other adventures in the anthology, Winter’s Teeth is intended to be dropped into a Northlands Saga campaign by the GM/Referee at any time or place that is convenient. It is not, therefore, tied to any particular location in the Northlands or to any specific time beyond occurring in the depths of winter.

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character level: 6-8

194451.name: Legend of the Elements
194451.description:
From publisher blurb:

Elemental magic, martial arts and wuxia action meet in this tabletop roleplaying game inspired by Avatar: The Last Airbender!

194452.name: Xyster Turret
194452.description:
From publisher blurb:

Years ago a Gnome female named Carlota retired from adventuring and built a small tower not far from Dano’s Point. While the illusionist/tinker kept to herself her home was reputed to have a cache of magical items from years on the trail. It has been several years since anyone has seen the diminutive woman and she is believed to be deceased. As you begin your adventuring career you decide that a trip to the tower is in order. If Carlota is alive, perhaps she can give you advice, if she isn’t perhaps you can help yourselves to some of her items.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a party of first level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

194453.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This gorgeous full-color foam play mat is inspired by the overworlds and dungeons of classic video games and is optimized for two player games.
194453.name: Boss Monster 2: The Next Level – The Playmat

194454.name: El Alamein: Rommel at Alam El Halfa
194454.description:
From the publisher:

In August 1942, Erwin Rommel, the "Desert Fox," had just completed his masterpiece of the desert war, breaking the British Eighth Army at Gazala, capturing Tobruk, and driving deep into Egypt. The British reformed near El Alamein, just 90 miles from Alexandria. After the repulse of a hasty attack in mid-July, Rommel orchestrated a more careful assault for the end of the month. His mobile troops were to swing wide into the desert to flank the British line and unhinge it. Eighth Army was waiting, forewarned by ULTRA intercepts. Its new commander, Bernard Mongomery, arrayed his armor along the ridge of Alam el Halfa. The German assault would pit the tactical finesse of Afrika Korps against greater numbers of tanks and guns. A German victory might complete the clearance of North Africa; a British victory could spell the end of Afrika Korps. El Alamein uses the Fire & Movement system designed around the realities of mechanized warfare, giving motorized and/or specially-trained units clear advantages. Players can augment units at the instant of combat with support fire, provided by weapons ranging from mortars through cannon and light ground attack aircraft to heavy bombers. A seemingly predictable assault can be overturned at the last minute by heavy defending fires, while even small units may develop tremendous offensive punch with the assistance of a heavy bombardment. Winning the battle is a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

194455.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Cards of Cthulhu Bonus Pack is a cellophane package that includes 10 Custom Copper Cthulhu Metal Coins and 5 Custom Silver Cthulhu Metal Coins. The coins expand the game play for The Cards of Cthulhu. Players can also add them for any of their other favorite games to spice up the Cthulhu feel and flavor.
194455.name: The Cards of Cthulhu: Coin Pack

194456.name: 1879: Mins Corebook
194456.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to 1879! The British Empire, passing through an interdimensional portal, has found a new world, the Gruv, chock-full of resources and land to be exploited. In the process, though, they've run headlong into the Samsut, descendants of ancient Babylonians who've been living there for over three thousand years. Now the might of the Empire clashes with the weird science of the Samsut. The Saurids, a reptilian race native to the new world, contest with both empires to retain their ancestral lands. Who will control the Gruv? That's up to your battles to decide! This miniatures game focuses on the military aspects of the period providing the Universal 18 ruleset and basic information about the British and Samsut forces, and a series of Forcebooks detailing the various military forces on Earth and on the Gruv.

194457.name: Legends of the Ancient World: Ebon Rebirth
194457.description:
Ebon Rebirth is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

From the publisher:
"...You are here for one simple reason; these are lean times. Resources are scarce, not enough for the various peoples of the Wildlands to survive, much less the scavengers. Symbonn has a reputation for providing opportunity to the desperate. It will take some bloody work, but you are confident that you will rise to the challenges that you will face, and survive..."

194458.name: Sentinel Shien Expert
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194458.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cunningly wield your light saber with the Shien Expert Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Full-color thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily and quickly reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. Shien Experts are pragmatic practitioners of light saber fighting. They know that winning a fight depends as much on staying mentally flexible, using the environment, and having good timing as it does physical strength. A Shien Expert's cunning is just as powerful a weapon as his blade. This is not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194459.name: Sentinel Artisan
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194459.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Use the Force to innovate and create with the Artisan Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Full-color thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily and quickly reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. Artisans are innately skilled artificers and engineers that feel the Force surrounding the tools, items, and materials they work with. They use that connection to solve mechanical problems in intuitive ways and, above all, to build wondrous, powerful technological artifact and objects. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194460.name: Sentinel Shadow
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194460.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Patrol the galaxy's darkest streets with the Shadow Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily and quickly reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. In the days of the Jedi Order, some Jedi policed the galaxy's criminal underground, hunting out the Sith and others who had fallen to the dark side. Now, Shadows still patrol dark alleys and underworld hideaways, working tirelessly to bring justice to the streets. This is not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194461.name: Seeker Ataru Striker
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194461.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Defeat your opponents decisively and fast with the Ataru Striker Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. Ataru Strikers are trained to do battle in hostile, uncivilized environments where combat is best resolved as quickly as possible. They take risks and practice rapid, gymnastic light saber moves, using their natural athleticism to fight with ever fiber of themselves. This is not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194462.name: Seeker Pathfinder
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194462.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Explore the galaxy's wildernesses with the Pathfinder Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily and quickly reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. Pathfinders unite survival skills and Force powers to live off the land. These rugged individuals can forge deep bonds with animals and withstand the most hostile environments. They may work to support small tribes, pave the way for nascent colonies, or simply discover the natural secrets of unexplored worlds. This is not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194463.name: Seeker Hunter
rpgseries: Star Wars Force and Destiny Specialization Decks
194463.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Hunt bloodthirsty predators with the Hunter Specialization Deck for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny roleplaying game. Available through our in-house manufacturing division, The Factory, each Force and Destiny Specialization Deck includes twenty talent cards for a single specialization. Thematic art on every card helps immerse you more fully in the Star Wars universe. With these cards, players and GMs can easily and quickly reference the relevant talents and stay focused on the ongoing adventure. Hunters are gritty Force adepts that strive to restore natural balance to the wilderness. Armed with vigilance and ranged weaponry, they use their powers to track, confront, and slay malicious creatures - sentient or otherwise - that needlessly prey upon innocent life. This is not a standalone product. A copy of the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook is required to play.

194464.name: The Copper Jackals: Soldiers Without Compromise
194464.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete, robust, 5E compatible ruleset for high-octane, paramilitary fantasy action.

Evil reigns in the realm of Dragongrin. The Dismembered Lord extends his reach, heroes die beneath his steel, and the free lands kneel before his shadow. But the dark forces do not march unopposed – there are those who do the impossible in Dragongrin. They are called heroes, traitors, champions, and murderers – they are called Copper Jackals.

Wielding powers beyond even the most capable adventurers, the Copper Jackals are imbued with a mystical metal called Titan Copper. This metal instills them with special abilities that allow them to withstand even the deadliest of challenges. When all else fails, and the reinforcements have fled – that’s when the Copper Jackals thrive.

Take your vow and do the impossible with more than 130 pages of original RPG content.
Become a rugged hero with hundreds of powerful new player options.
Join a specialized chapter of Jackals, gaining unique abilities and magic items.
Learn of the epic history of the Jackals and their legendary heroes.
Generate countless action-packed missions with dozens of adventure roll tables.
Fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world’s oldest fantasy roleplaying game.




The Year of the Hero continues with The Copper Jackals, a roleplaying game supplement containing everything a player needs to become a special ops commando in a fantasy setting. In addition to new player options and hundreds of unique abilities, this book also features lore, magic items, and roll tables, all for use at your game table.

The Copper Jackals live, fight, and die without compromise – do you have what it takes?

194465.name: Erenoth: The Convocation
194465.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shadows linger in the land of Erenoth. But there is a flame in the darkness – an unwavering light that stands against evil and tyranny in all of its twisted forms: The Convocation. Take wing as a legendary Convoker, a griffon-riding warrior of justice and protector of the realm. With enchanted weaponry and armor, and a swath of superhuman abilities at your disposal, you must do what common mortal beings cannot, and stem the tides of darkness.

Suit up as a mighty Convoker with almost 50 pages of original RPG content.
Become a hero with dozens of powerful new player options that integrate seamlessly with existing class features.
Take flight on a unique griffon mount with special rules for training, riding, and customization.
Forge your legend with the magic weapons and armor of the Convocation.
Wage epic battles with included statblocks for a variety of Convokers and griffons.
Inspire fantastic worlds with a bounty of lore and history.
Fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world’s oldest fantasy roleplaying game.




The Convocation is a roleplaying game supplement containing everything you’ll need to become a mighty Convoker. In addition to player character options and robust rules for rearing a griffon mount, this book also features lore, magic items, player character options, roll tables, and non-player characters for use at your game table. This supplement is suitable for use with your favorite fantasy roleplaying game and campaign setting.

Under light of mercy, on wings of peace, and with steel of justice, the Convokers take flight – will you join them?

194466.description: Mage Wars: Academy – Priestess Expansion includes a new mage for use in both Mage Wars: Academy and Mage Wars: Arena. Now you can play as a holy Priestess competing to prove that the way of light is absolute by letting her smite the wicked and summon virtuous allies.
194466.name: Mage Wars: Academy – Priestess Expansion

194467.name: Dosdediez (Número 3 - Mar/Abr 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Análisis en profundidad - Shadowrun vs Cyberpunk
El futuro es desechable; tú también
Magic: the gathering; del juego a la obsesión en dos horas
De MERP a Runequest II - La magia en la Tierra Media
194467.description:
Dosdediez (first stage) Magazine #3
Summary in Spanish:

EDITORIAL
NOTICIAS
Importación, Tiendas, Noticias, Clubes, Fanzines y Actividades.
ROL EN VIVO
La Sombra sobre Madrid (Vampiro en vivo), por Gustavo Adolfo Díaz
NOVEDADES ESPAÑOLAS
Juego del mes; Ars Magica
NOVEDADES IMPORTACIÓN
Juego del mes; S.L.A. Industries
ANALISIS EN PROFUNDIDAD
Shadowrun vs Cyberpunk, por Óscar Díaz
JUEGOS DE ORDENADOR
Novedades e Importación
WARGAMES Y TEMATICOS
Warhammer; el juego de batallas fantásticas
Noticias del Frente, novedades y Revistas
LIBROS
BAREMO

Guía de Pintura
CORREO

194468.name: Conditioning Feats
194468.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock Your Potential!

A warrior spends hours on the training ground, sparring with others or hacking at combat dummies, building up his strength. Elsewhere, an aspiring ninja runs a gauntlet of nasty traps, attempting to make it through as quickly as possible, and without being hit, to improve her agility and reflexes, while a wizard pores over ancient tomes, memorizing facts and quizzing himself on them to improve his knowledge. A monk meditates under a waterfall, to better learn to block out distractions, and a bard decides to drop by a tavern and see if he can’t make a few friends, just so he’s not rusty at the upcoming banquet.

All of these characters are conditioning themselves. They are training, in one way or another to improve their abilities. And the more that they train, the better they will be. But training isn’t something you can just finish. It is a constant process, and must be maintained, or else muscles, memory, and even social skills can fade and become soft. In the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the only way for a character to improve themselves is through killing things and gaining experience, and no amount of training or practice will truly matter. This book presents 32 new feats that allow characters to gain conditioning pools, acquiring points for regular training, and then spending those points to perform incredible feats, or gaining passive bonuses based on how many points they have.

194469.name: Mega Man Legacy Collection
194469.description:
Mega Man Legacy Collection is a celebration of the 8-bit history of Capcom’s iconic Blue Bomber. Featuring faithful reproductions of the series’ origins with the original six Mega Man games, the Legacy Collection will remind long-time fans and introduce newcomers to what made Mega Man such a popular and iconic character. Mega Man Legacy Collection will feature all six games and much more.

In addition to the six Mega Man games, Mega Man Legacy Collection features new ways to experience the classic games with the Museum Mode and new Challenge Mode. Challenge Mode remixes gameplay segments from all six games, with plenty of scaling difficulty objectives for experienced players to conquer yet serving as a good starting point for new players, too. Museum Mode contains a comprehensive collection of history, high-res art and original concept pieces – a mega treat for any fan of Mega Man and video game history.

Source: The Publisher Website.

194470.description: This mini-expansion introduces the Elementals that can change the suit of a card you play on your turn giving you more control on when to score!
194470.name: ManaSurge: Elementals

boardgamecompilation: Villages of Valeria: Deluxe Kickstarter Edition
194471.description: This Bonus Pack introduces a new Event mechanic. Players shuffle in Events in to the deck and when they are revealed through card drafting, players do the action on the cards. Along with the new Event cards, the Bonus Pack also includes 4 new Adventurers - Baron, Champion, Bishop, and Sorceress.
194471.name: Villages of Valeria: Events

194472.name: Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes
194472.description:
Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes is a tabletop board game simulation of a real-life modern sport which is based on a fictional gladiatorial sport featured in a 1980's cult movie, "The Blood of Heroes" (also known as "The Salute of the Jugger" and "Salute to the Jugger").

The 1989 movie, "The Blood of Heroes", filmed in Australia and starring Rutger Hauer portrays a post-apocalyptic world, similar to the Mad Max movies, in which the central focus of the bedraggled society is a brutal gladiatorial game called "The Game". In this movie a rag-tag team of players, called "Juggers", fight their way through the barren lands to earn the right to play in the big league of The Nine Cities.

The cult following of the movie saw the emergence of Jugger as a sport where the brutal weapons in the movie were replaced with padded foam weapons (also known as spars or pompfen). First emerging in Germany, Sport Jugger quickly spread through out Europe, Australia, and the Americas. So popular has the sport become that in 2014 the German World Masters Tournament, The Deutsche Meisterschaft, attracted 74 Jugger teams from across the world.

In 2015 Jugger fanatic and games designer, Stuart Shaw, took on the challenge of creating a tabletop board game by fusing his game system, Siostam, with modern Sport Jugger rules. The result is an exhilarating, fast paced action tabletop game, Jugger TTG: Dogskull Heroes, where you get to take charge of your own Jugger team and lead them to victory and glory against the best Jugger players in the world.

194473.name: Risou no Natto
194473.description:
User summary:
理想の納豆 (Risou no Natto) means Ideal Natto in English. Nattō is fermented soya beans, a side dish which people either love or hate.

Players work to make their ideal bowl of Natto rice by adding the toppings they like, avoiding the toppings they don't, and mixing their Natto to the perfect gooey consistency.

Each player gets two "preference" cards that only they see. These dictate the toppings they want at the end of the game. Players take turns drawing and playing topping cards and mix cards onto several piles in the middle of the table. Whenever they feel the time is right, they can choose to dig in and "eat" their Natto by choosing a pile from the centre of the table. Once all players have decided to eat, scores are totalled, and the person with their most ideal (based on the score from topping cards) and sufficiently mixed Natto (based on the value of the mix cards) is the winner.

The game was first published in 2014 and a new edition produced for Spiel 2016 with Japanese rules in the box, and English, German and French rules added outside the box for buyers.

Publisher's summary
In the card game Ideal Natto, you mix the packets of natto on the table with different toppings like green onion and raw egg, stirring it multiple times until it is prepared just so. And then you must grab your favorite natto before someone else does!

This is a game of reading other players’ intentions and secretly setting your eyes on your “Ideal Natto” – eat the most delicious natto to win the game!

Our game 'Ideal Natto' is officially endorsed by the Japan Natto Cooperative Society Federation.

boardgamecompilation: Villages of Valeria: Deluxe Kickstarter Edition
194474.description:
Guild Halls introduces 4 new buildings - 1 for each type. When built, a Guild Hall will reward the player with Victory Points if they have the most of that Guild Hall's building type.

Guild Halls also introduces rapid-recruit Adventurers that only require 1 building type icon in your village to recruit. They offer some quick but low points and immediate rewards.

Guild Halls will build upon the Event cards mechanic. Skeletons, Jesters, and more!
194474.name: Villages of Valeria: Guild Halls

194475.name: Faithless and Forgotten, Part 1: Let Bygones Be
194475.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5.

Ever since the tragedy at Delvehaven decades ago, the infernal empire Cheliax has rarely allowed Pathfinders to explore its many ruins and archaeological treasures—even then only after its recently disenfranchised liaison Zarta Dralneen fought for that privilege. Cheliax has once again extended its hand to the Society, inviting its agents to investigate an abandoned keep that dates back to the Chelish civil war. It's up to the PCs to navigate the Corentyn's streets and politics as they uncover the buried past and lay the foundation for a new partnership with a one-time foe.

"Let Bygones Be" is the first scenario in the three-part Faithless and Forgotten campaign arc. It is followed by Pathfinder Society Scenario #7-16: "Lost Colony of Taldor" and Pathfinder Society Scenarios #7-18: "The Infernal Inheritance." All three chapters are intended to be played in order.

Written by Brian J. Fruzen, RPG Superstar 2015 finalist.

194476.name: Munch-Mausen Tales
194476.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all "Munch-Mausen", able to assume the shape of a small humanoid, a rat, or something in between. Character creation involves selecting Traits (narrative tags); "narrow" or "broad" Traits are allowed, each costing points from a creation pool. Characters then select a "catchphrase", which grants bonuses during play if used.

194478.description:
Ultra Coins is a collectible coin game that uses solid brass coins to represent a player's army that is comprised of characters from fantasy, science fiction, and horror. A coin can represent a force of soldiers or a powerful individual. Some coins are more powerful than others and all coins have different special abilities.

Each coin is 2 inches in diameter. The front of a coin has the artwork representing the character. On the outer perimeter are numbers that represent the character's attack and defense values. The inner ring contains the character's name, rank, and special abilities.

The back of the coin has a tip which allows the coin to spin. The coin can spin on a game mat, notebook, table, etc.

The spinning of the coin represents the random element of an attack or defense. After the coin is spinning, a players stops it with their finger and uses the number next to their finger.

There is no game board, no dice, and no markers. The only thing you need are the coins. The game is modular which allows players to battle with only a few coins. They can expand the battles as they collect additional coins.
194478.name: Ultra Coins

194479.name: Mistborn: Allomancy Dice
194479.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Mistborn Allomancy Dice set includes ten (10) high-quality acrylic dice, each of which replaces the 6 face with a unique Allomantic magic symbol - the same art seen in the hugely popular Mistborn novel series. Together, these symbols represent the physical metals (Pewter, Tin, Iron, and Steel) along with the mental metals (Copper, Bronze, Zinc, or Brass), plus Gold and the all-powerful element, Atium - all the known metals of the Mistborn world.

194480.name: Cosmic Handbook
194480.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The cosmos is a vast realm of primal powers, alien empires, and wonders and dangers beyond imagining. Now it is yours to explore with The Cosmic Handbook for the Mutants & Masterminds Superhero Roleplaying Game. This sourcebook looks at the universe beyond Earth, from the history of the cosmic in the comics to the conventions of cosmic stories and characters. In the pages of The Cosmic Handbook you will find advice and rules for creating characters and adventures in the depths of space. GMs get ready-to-use villains, from space tyrants and aliens to nigh-omnipotent cosmic beings, and an expanded look at the universe of Freedom City and Emerald City beyond the bounds of Earth. Get ready, heroes. Infinity awaits!

194481.name: 10 Second Ninja X
194481.description:
10 SECOND NINJA X is a blisteringly fast, satisfyingly difficult and surprisingly methodical sidescroller which tasks you with completing each level in ten seconds or less. No lengthy checkpoint gaps. No cluttered control scheme. No hand holding.

Source: The Developer Website.

194482.name: 15 Days
194482.description:
User Summary

A three-man activist group has set out to make the world a better place by stealing famous pieces of art in the world's most renowned museums, selling them to private collectors, and donating the money to charity.

194483.name: Adam's Venture Chronicles
194483.description:
User Summary

Adam Venture is a renowned explorer and adventurer. During his epic adventures, set in the 1920’s, he encounters antique artifacts, ancient mysteries and the player will decipher strange symbols.

194484.name: Basement
194484.description:
User Summary
Basement is a drug-dealing strategy game where you play a scientist who is forced to do illegal stuff in your basement.

194485.name: Bumbledore
194485.description:
User Summary

Throw fireballs, call down lightning, and summon volcanoes to defend your hive from annihilation!

194486.name: Concursion
194486.description:
User Summary

Dark Lord Biganbad has - sigh - once again kidnapped the princess. But this time his evil schemes have gone too far and torn open a number of rifts between realities.

194487.name: Hounds: The Last Hope
194487.description:
There is no place for cowards here. Here we fight to the last drop of our blood. Here we fight to the death for the salvation of mankind. This is the place for Hounds soldiers and their followers who want to fight for the last hope! Are you ready for the Hounds: The Last Hope?

Netmarble EMEA presents Hounds with the BUFF quality in 2015. Hounds is a unique game which blends the role playing elements with action genre. You can play Hounds with your friends or alone. In Hounds, you’ll fight against dangerous enemies on tough missions. In PvP mode you can show your skills to other players.

With the new generation graphics and story mode with fully dubbed cutscenes it’s real pleasure to play Hounds. There are many details in the game which you can’t find in regular action games. You can create your dream soldier with customization options and show your skills to others on tournaments.

Hounds: The Last Hope which is now in the test stage will be released free to play in 2015.

Visit www.houndsonline.com for details and Beta access.

Source: The Developer Website.

194488.description:
Description from the publisher:

In times of yore, loyal knights would ride out to do their king's bidding. These knights have stumbled into the dungeon and are now in your way. Draw your steel and show them who's the king around here. Munchkin Knights has fifteen shiny new cards to add some Knight to your day!
194488.name: Munchkin Knights

194489.name: Munchkin Meeples
194489.description:
Description from the publisher:

Show your Munchkin pride in any game using meeple-type figures! The Munchkin Meeples set includes six different meeple designs, each of which has one Mega-Meeple and four Non-Mega-Meeples — and they have in-game bonuses!

194491.name: Regis Furor: Kings of Rage
194491.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game have two Attributes, Badge and Rat. The Badge represents the "good" aspects of the character (skill, ability, power) while The Rat represents the "dark" aspects of the character (fear, vice, fate). Actions are resolved through a simple modified 2d6 roll compared to an opponent's roll (there are no unopposed rolls in the system).

194492.name: Secrets in Suburbia
194492.description:
From the introduction:

As the stress in your suburban lifestyle builds, things are going to get out of hand and it's up to you, as a player, to decide how this ends. Do you keep up appearances and deal with your responsibilities, or do you go off the rails and find a way out of suburbia?

User summary:

Note - the game uses a "two-up" layout for printing, yielding different page counts for the PDF document (13) vs. the internal pagination (26).

194493.name: She's...
194493.description:
User summary:

The game uses determined roles of the "four ways in which the Guys experience the Girl...Girlfriend (Heart); Hot (Diamonds); Bitch (Clubs); and Frigid (Spades)." Each Role has a value between 2 and 10. Characters also have various other Abilities, depending on their determined roles.

Note: the game is not "politically correct".

194494.name: Sleep Over
194494.description:
From the introduction:

Sleep Over is a nasty little roleplaying game where you take the role of a teenage girl who is attending a sleep Over. Together with the other girls you spend the night gossiping about boys, cloths, movies, music, sex, who’s fat, who’s hot, or who’s not. You find out who your real friends are, and who you want to just kill. Be careful though, in this day and age... sometimes girls do kill.

194495.name: The Suburban Crucible
194495.description:
User summary:

The game presents a single scenario where a boy from a white, middle-class suburban family introduces his family - for the first time - to his girlfriend, who they learn is black. The entire game narrative deals with the subtle racism that ensues (the game establishes the characters are not "bad people" or overtly racist). Characters have various Traits, with numeric ratings, depending on their role in the situation. The numeric ratings determine the size of the d10 dice pool used during action resolution.

194496.name: Risk: Captain America – Civil War Edition
194496.description:
It's Captain America vs. Iron Man in the search for the Winter Soldier! Wage an all-out battle at the airport in this exciting updated Risk game. Control the most territories, capture the Winter Soldier, and escape with the Quinjet before it reaches the end of the runway! Choose to play with 2 or 4 players. With 2 players, each player is in control of either Team Captain America (Captain America and Falcon) or Team Iron Man (Iron Man and War Machine). With 4 players, each player is in control of his or her own hero and works in teams of 2. No matter which way of play is chosen, after 5 rounds of excitement and strategy, the game is over, and mission tokens are scored. The team with the most points wins the game!


Exciting updated Risk game
Features Captain American, Falcon, Iron Man, and War Machine figures
Play as Team Captain America or Team Iron Man
2 ways to play

194497.name: Want (2005)
194497.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all suburban housewives who, by the rules, "cannot do anything productive with their lives and their time". Thus, the focus of play becomes petty infighting among frustrated and scornful competitors.

Characters have five Attributes: Frustration, Hatred, Things, Wants, and Insecurity. Insecurity further is divided into Status, Clout, and Dignity, each represented by a d6 of a specified color.

rpg: My Girlfriend's a Slut / My Boyfriend's a Dick
194498.name: My Girlfriend's a Slut / My Boyfriend's a Dick
194498.description:
User summary:

The game is for two players, one assuming the role of the Boyfriend and the other assuming the role of the Girlfriend. The Boyfriend has four Attributes: Obsession, Hatred, Self-Worth, and Humiliation. The Girlfriend has two Attributes: Affection and Self-Righteousness. The game presupposes a significant interpersonal conflict between the couple and the narrative action seeks to resolve the conflict in one way or another. A dice pool mechanism can be utilized for opposed action resolution.

194499.description:
Quadropolis: Game Store is a single tile that functions like a shop in Quadropolis — meaning that it earns its owner points at the end of the game based on the number of customers in it — but it features a black die in one corner that provides additional scoring when used in combination with Quadropolis: Tric Trac, a public utility tile that earns its owner one point for each game store on that player's board.

Quadropolis: Game Store exists in 23 different versions, with the only difference among them being the store's name and logo. These tiles were distributed to customers who bought Quadropolis from the associated game stores in France.

You can get the Quadropolis: Game Store in these 23 variations: AgoraJeux (AJ), BellaCiao, C’est le Jeu, Descartes Bordeaux, Descartes Lyon, Espace-temps, La Diagonale du Fou, Labyrinthe, Le Bazar du Bizarre, Le Village du Jeu, Ludibay, Ludifolie, Ludocortex, Les Ludovores, Librairie Martelle, Meisa, Philibert, Le Repaire du Dragon, Rocambole, Sur La Route du Jeu, Sortilèges, Starplayer and Troll2Jeux.
194499.name: Quadropolis: Game Store

194500.description:
Quadropolis: Tric Trac replaces Public Service tile 1416, and in addition to functioning as a Public Service for scoring, this tile gives its owner one additional point for every Quadropolis: Game Store tile in that player's city.

Quadropolis: Tric Trac was distributed at the Tric Trac booth at the 2016 Festival International des Jeux.
194500.name: Quadropolis: Tric Trac
